ReviewText: You really feel like you are in old Hollywood when you stay at the Beverly Hills Hotel, and the staff treat you like you're a star. It doesn't look like every other hotel, and I loved that. The rooms are very comfortable, the pool is great fun, and the gardens are beautiful. ReviewTitle: Perfect place for a stay in LA

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: They set a high standard for service. We always feel that we get great value. The hotel is amazing as is the service. We will be back. I highly recommend the Polo Bar for dinner and drinks it is also great for people watching.

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: We love this hotel and will come back. Travelling family of 4 (2 boys age 9 & 14). We booked interconnecting rooms and the only downside of the stay was on the first night at check-in the desk made no mention that they did not actually have interconnecting rooms for us and our rooms were a few rooms apart. When I called and asked what had happened it was explained to me that I had booked adjacent/adjoining and this did not mean connecting rooms. I looked at my booking and email trail and it was absolutely clear to me that I had booked connecting rooms. They did fix it and that was greatly appreciated. But they had a real crack at blowing me off when I sought to check which makes you feel quite uncomfortable. Rest of the time the service at the hotel was excellent. We made great use of the polo lounge, the pool and the gym. So if travelling as a family be quite specific about booking and don't get brushed off if something goes awry.

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: We decided to try something different this year and not get on a plane for Valentine's Day. With Beverly Hill's in our own backyard, we thought it would be fun to explore Rodeo Drive and Beverly Hills. After a lot of research, the Beverly Hills Hotel seemed like the obvious choice. Great decision!! Everything was perfect. Sam at the Front Desk was awesome and everyone we encountered on our visit made us feel special. Luis at the Polo Lounge was very accommodating and makes some great cocktails!! The entire staff from the Valet, Housekeeping and overall staff gets 5 stars. The location of this hotel is great, and they offer complimentary shuttle service within 3 miles of the property. I cannot recommend this place enough. Do yourself a favor and book a trip to the Beverly Hills Hotel soon, you will not be disappointed.

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: We stayed in a bungalow here and we still rant and rave about how this was the ultimate experience. Our bungalow had a study, full kitchen with butlers' entrance, a living room, dining area, large bedroom, a FANTASTIC bathroom (complete with heated tile floors, TVs in the mirrors and close the glass door and it turned into a sauna), an outdoor shower, oh, and last but not least, A PRIVATE POOL. The entire hotel is lovely, and the staff is fantastic. I would recommend indulging if you can :)

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: This really is the pink hotel. Tucked away in Beverly Hills. Staff are very friendly and whilst the hotel is a little tired it's still stunning. The beds are very comfortable and my room is lovely and ample in size. The bathroom is spacious with pink and black tiling which I love very deco in style. After thanks giving they decorated the hotel for xmas over night wow stunning magical. The facilities are great. Worth a visit and stay here

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: let me just tell you that staying in a Beverly Hills Hotel bungalow was quite epic: they have been in the past shelter for some the world’s most famous icons such as Elizabeth Taylor, Marilyn Monroe and Marlene Dietrich. A couple of months ago, I returned to the Pink Palace, this time to try the recently refurbished rooms of the main building. Since 2012 through the end of 2014, the hotel had been subject to restoration in order to update its appearance and features, and of course ultimately offer a better guest experience. One thing that hasn't changed, however, is the service and the staff attention to the guests' comfort and needs... Everyone used to Dorchester Collection hotels will tell you that ! The least I can say is, and without much surprise, that it’s a tremendous success. Although I had not previously stayed at the hotel’s main building, it was quite obvious to note the multiple cutting-edge technology features (ah, those illuminated mirrors with built-in televisions…) and sophisticated new palettes… All while feeling the timeless, classical Hollywood glamour atmosphere of the property as if I was a golden age movie star :) In my room, the hotel’s signature pink and green colors were higlighted with materials such as soft leather and rich mohair in shades of cream and taupe. It also felt exceptionally cosy, needless to say. Besides the walnut, ebonized oak, and parchment lacquered furniture added depth to the ambience – especially when accentuated with the custom, antique bronze lighting fixtures lights… Sophisticated new features and amenities include B&O TVs with integrated technology and illuminated mirrors with built-in televisions, as previously mentioned... The thoughtfully-crafted restoration that I was able to observe hones and honors the original patina of The Beverly Hills Hotel, restoring and polishing its iconic design elements. The Beverly Hills Hotel definitely deserves its worldwide reputation, as one of the best and most iconic hotels ever.
ReviewTitle: back at The Beverly Hills Hotel !

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: Another perfect stay at the Beverly Hills Hotel. I had a quiet room very nicely furnished. Breakfast is special as you can eat a Mexican omelette if you wish. The gym, although small, is equipped with state of the art equipment from Technogym. I highly recommend it!

ProviderLocation: 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-2938 9641 Sunset Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-2938
ReviewText: I'm so happy I crossed this hotel off my bucket list, but I loved it so much I definitely need to make it back here at some point. Even the most basic room feels so luxe. I'm a history nerd, so I stay at a lot of historic hotels, and while It oozes old Hollywood, but it doesn't feel like an old hotel at all because everything from the gardens to bathrooms are so immaculately maintained. The service is incredible, everyone was beyond nice and helpful. I ate dinner and breakfast in the Polo Lounge- both were delicious! The bar by the pool has a great menu and drinks too. This place is definitely pricey, but you really get what you're paying for. If you're looking for old Hollywood luxury, you'd be doing yourself a disservice to not stay here!
ReviewTitle: One of the best hotel stays I've ever had!

9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: You know that you are going to be well taken care of when you've been nicely greeted by 5 different staff members before even reaching the check in desk. That set the tone for the entire evening. Every staff member was polite, courteous and very helpful. While you clearly pay for this service, it is money well spent. I would definitely return here if travel takes me back to LA.
ReviewTitle: Everything you want in helpful, friendly staff

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: Fabulous. Need I say more? The front entrance and lobby Xmas decor was near perfect and gave a wonderful ambiance. ReviewTitle: Xmas decor and so much more

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: This another of my favorite places to stay. So romantic. We got the suite and they had business cards on the desk with our names on them. OMG! ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: The Peninsula understands and delivers the best of best customer service. Everyone is attentive to your every need. Not to mention, the location of the hotel is perfect. You can either walk to all the shopping or they have several cars and will arrange transportation for you within Beverly Hill. This hotel is beautiful and impeccable. Always a favorite.
ReviewTitle: Always an amazing stay at the Peninsula Beverly Hills

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: I have stayed at The Peninsula Beverly Hills for many years. The staff of this fabulous hotel makes a point to give me the best service one could ask for. Gary Thomson always greets me like an old friend. We talk about what's happening in sports being from Boston. It means a lot. Jim Assi always greets me with a smile. I look forward to seeing these guys while in town. Along with the great restaurants, the Blueberry Pancakes are simply the best! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys living well!!

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: The wonderful Hotel is located exactly where you need to be in Beverly Hills, they haven't missed a detail, every inch what one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Loved the personal attention! The roof top pool is the perfect place to end your day.

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: The Peninsula Beverly Hills is a place of ultimate luxury, as I realized right upon my arrival. As I pulled up in front of the entrance, I couldn’t help but notice the ballet of eye-catching cars: Ferraris, Bentleys, Rolls Royces… A ballet perfectly coordinated with the abundance of « it » bags, outstanding jewelry, designer outfits – and pretty much all the other symbols of glitz and glam you could expect to find in the very heart of Beverly Hills. As I later walked into the hotel, a feeling of extreme comfort added up to that of luxury, as the helpful staff took great care of my since I stepped out of the car, and until I checked into my room – even giving me an opportunity to try the Club Bar while I was waiting for the final arrangements to be made in my room. Located right next to the lobby, the Club Bar is reminiscent of a handsome den, with beautiful California birch-paneled walls and gleaming brass details and sconces. The Peninsula Beverly Hills looks and feels like an exclusive private residence built in classic Renaissance style. My 480 square feet (45 square meters) Deluxe room reflected that chic and precious Renaissance feeling, with oversized furniture, from the bed to the desks. As you would expect, it also featured all possible high tech equipments, from HDTV to iPod deck, Bose stereo system, and even a multi-function color printer. Apparently the most popular choice for guests, the Deluxe room also has multi-function bedside electronic control panels, and the most unexpected attention awaits you once you walk into your room: your own pillow case, customized with your initials, fresh fruits… Ultimate attention, true luxury. Beyond the impeccably furnished rooms and outstanding restaurants and bars, what makes the Peninsula Beverly Hills really stand out definitely is its incredible rooftop pool. In a lush garden setting, it is surrounded by 12 cabanas equipped with everything from air conditioning and heat to flat-screen TVs.
ReviewTitle: ultimate luxury at The Peninsula, Beverly Hills

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: Spa is fantastic and something is special about the rooftop pool I highly recommend it. As far as for the younger demographic goes, not sure if this would be my first choice for you. The hotel has somewhat of a boutique and cosy feel but offers full services and amenities. My room did smell of smoke perhaps the room next door, and they moved me to a nice and very quite room. 5 stars

ProviderLocation: 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills , CA 90212 9882 South Santa Monica Blvd , Beverly Hills, CA 90212
ReviewText: My wife visited the restaurant with a friend and she raved about the food. She even tried tuna tartare for the first time and she said she loved it. ReviewTitle: The food is out of the world

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: The hotel was in a fantastic location to shops,restaurants and to bus,travel and walking to places. It is an older building but it is clean and the staff are very helpful. I loved the fact i could wash and dry clothing and make coffee and heat food when wanted. The breakfast was continental and good to begin a day. Around the corner is a terrific Italian restaurant. So close to everything and i would definitely stay there again.Walked to CVS store right next to the Hollywood walk of fame. Quiet.

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: This place is an excellent base for exploring Los Angeles. A free breakfast is included in the room rate - includes bagels, muffins, yogurt, juices, fruit, croissants and you have a full kitchen in your room to cook anything else you desire. The location is excellent, 2 minutes walk from Hollywood and Highland train station which can take you north to Universal Studios or south to Downtown LA and Union Station. It's also right behind the Hollywood Walk of Fame and the various attractions along that area. The bed is comfortable and the closet has ample space for bags and hanging clothes. There is also a laundry in the basement for use at a cost (about $1.50 for a load of washing from memory), which is very convenient when you are on an extended trip. The staff are also very friendly and willing to help you with anything you need.

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: I've stayed at the Orchid Suites Hotel now for four times, using different room types. The total impression was just great. Not just the location with less than 5 minutes walk to the Hollywood Blvd but also cleanliness of the rooms, friendliness of staff and quality of breakfast. We are currently planning our next trip to L.A., and though rental car and flight are dependant from the prices, we have decided that Orchid Suites is the place to stay. 5 out of 5 (I would give 6 if I could).

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Situated just off Hollywood Blvd it is close to all the attractions,rooms are good size with full kitchen,security is good and they have lockup carparkso. We stayed here 20 years apart and had a great time both times,we wish we could get there more often.The staff is friendly and very helpful.

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: I could not have been more impressed with this hotel. Exceeded my expectation in every way! First of all, I wasn't expecting much considering the price is so low compared to other LA hotels. But it is perfect as a base when visiting LA and definitely a place for extend stay as well. It is so spacious, and bear in mind that I got myself the smallest room. It has a living room with sofa, coffee table and a TV. There is also a counter-top area and open kitchen. Fully-equipped one with toaster and microwave oven as well as 4-fire stoves for cooking. Dining table with 4 chairs are available as well. The bedroom is spacious enough with a king sized bed and 2 bedside tables & lamps. Plenty of storage space for us. The bathroom has heater to keep the air warm when it gets cold. How thoughtful and comfortable. The pantry area is opened 24 hours with free flow of coffee, tea, water and hot chocolate. The complimentary breakfast consist of bagels, croissants, muffins, yogurt, cereals, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and bread. But the best of all is the breakfast lady, Patricia. She is so welcoming and full of positive energy! I promised her I will be back and I will, just to see her again. Really, you see her and you will want to see her again. You feel happy just having her around and chatting with you. All the other staff are so friendly and helpful. Really warm our hearts. Thanks so much for making our stay a wonderful one.
ReviewTitle: A true gem!! You will want to be back.

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Cute and quiet but perfect location away from the hustle and bustle. Breakfast was pretty good! Make sure you feed the resident squirrel. Just behind the old Kodak theatre. Clean rooms, pleasant staff

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Had a fantastic week at Hollywood Orchid Suites in May/June 2015. Lovely 1 bedroom apartment and spotlessly clean.Will stay there again when I'm next in Hollywood Patricia,the breakfast lady was great,so friendly

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Excellent position right on Hollywood walk and very reasonable pricing. Staff very helpful. Rooms clean with small kitchen. Outside pool. Free wifi. Walking distance to attractions and close to transport.

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Stayed 3 nights in October. Stayed here based on various forum recommendations esp from other Aussies and wasn't disappointed. Location is about 1 minute behind the Chinese Theatre, and the craziness of Hollywood Blvd and you wouldn't know it - very quiet street. Not the cheapest or newest place around but still very good value for what you get. I was in a junior double room and it was huge. I kid you not. Heaps of storage space, room safe, aircon, good bathroom, kitchenette with utensils, refrigerator, stove top but no microwave and good free wifi. I was in a room down the back and the view was the wall of the adjacent building, not a problem just an observation. I had a rental car for 2 of the 3 nights I was there and there is paid underground security parking with a lift up to the rooms. It's more of an apartment building than a motel or hotel and gives off a good vibe. All the staff I had dealings with were really professional and also very nice. I didn't partake in the breakfasts they offered - just grabbed a banana on my way out. There are washing machines and dryers in the basement area which take quarters. I also noticed a PC and printer for use by guests too. There's a pool also. One thing to note, if you have a rental car, be aware that Franklin Avenue which is the road you have to come along to get to the Orchid is pretty well gridlocked in peak am and pm times - well it was when I was there. Great place to stay. As I said earlier, not the cheapest but value for money would be hard to beat.
ReviewTitle: A unique place to stay. First rate establishment with staff to match.

ProviderLocation: 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1753 Orchid Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: This is the best place to stay in Hollywood! Right in the centre of everything and yet quiet and peaceful. I had the Executive King Room and it was clean, spacious and modern. The price is extremely good value compared to other local hotels. The security is very good. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast lady who was an absolute pleasure! This will be my first choice anytime I return now.

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: We had a great experience at L'Ermitage. Everyone was so friendly, the valet guys, the desk people, the bartender. We felt so welcome. Our room was very lovely, clean, the bathroom had lots of room for our stuff on the counters, and a private toilet/shower room. They really thought out the guest experience when they renovated. And the location was convenient, we walked into Beverly Hills.

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: We stayed late February after a ski trip to Colorado and needed some relax time before the long flight to Sydney. We took advantage of the "Suite Deal" - pay for two nights and stay three. The Beverly Suite was really oversized! Two full bathrooms, two huge dressing rooms, kitchen with microwave and Nespresso machine and super large bedroom and lounge/dining. The two balconies were a bonus to let fresh air in and view the surrounds. The decor is current and the property is immaculate. It is an easy, flat stroll to Beverly Hills shopping and restaurants. There is a Whole Foods close by and lovely restaurants such as Bouchon Bistro. We usually stay at the Sunset Tower in West Hollywood but it was not taking bookings for the Oscar weekend. If I was travelling alone, I would choose the Viceroy - very safe and friendly. If accompanied by my partner, I'd opt for the Sunset Tower - old school Hollywood.

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: My Wife and I stayed at the Viceroy for one night on the way to New Zealand. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us after arriving from an early AM flight. Most significant though was the way they handled our departure. We had scheduled a limo for the ride to the airport. Pick up time came and went and no car arrived. When I called Wilshire, I was told that the car was scheduled for 9:45, our flight departure time and not 6:30 as we had requested. When Erica (at the reception desk) heard my conversation, she immediately stepped in and ordered a replacement car and we went on to the airport as planned. This even though the error was with Wilshire and not the hotel. The only negative note is that our room overlooked the street. Despite the doors having heavy laminated glass the noise of the traffic below was quite prominent. The problem being that there is no seal on the threshold and the sound passes right through the gap. To their credit, they did offer to move us to another room.

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: Room was fabulous, gym was great, lots of things that I never knew I wanted were there. There are some niggles. Coffee wasn't refilled in the room and dirty glasses were neither cleaned nor replaced by housekeeping, even after complaining. Service in the restaurant and bar was poor. Nearly wonderful.
ReviewTitle: Great property but a couple of niggles

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: We live in LA but like to get away for a night or two for a luxurious stay-cation. This hotel has such a nice relaxed vibe with attentive service, delicious food and they even make a great cup of tea! It was quiet and the rooms are big with balconies that let in air. Such a nice experience.

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: I stayed at the Viceroy L'Ermitage for an R&R weekend on my way back to NYC after two weeks in Tokyo. The room was very nice, and the staff courteous and responsive. I spent most of the weekend with friends in West Hollywood or nursing my jet lag (which the room was excellent for), and when I did head out from the hotel into Beverly Hills, the areas I wanted to get to were all within walking distance or a very short car ride. I would stay again.
ReviewTitle: Five Star Hotel in Great Beverly Hills Location

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: The hotel is very beautiful. I had a suite facing the front of the hotel. The room was gorgeously decorated and spacious. I loved the large dressing area and the large bathroom! The bell hops, concierge (shout out to Dana and his great recommendations), and bartenders were amazing! (I wasn't that fond of the front desk people) I took advantage of the roof deck/pool area and fitness center during my stay. The areas were very clean and well kept! The hotel is walking distance to great shopping and dining. During the daytime hours I would mostly walk. In the evening, the hotel offers a car service to take you to locations near the hotel. If you are gonna do Beverly Hills, this is how you do it!

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: I returned for the third time, but my first since the remodel. It was wonderful. The rooms are large and now fresh and quite beautiful. If you prefer smaller 5 star properties, this is it. Monica at the front desk is excellent!!

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: The hotel was excellent. The suite was amazingly comfortable and large, the bed and pillows were superb. The location was very good. The staff as phenomenal. The exercise machines were top notch, and they preloaded them with a bottle of water and a towel. I highly recommend this hotel. No complaints whatsoever.

ProviderLocation: 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3709 9291 Burton Way , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3709
ReviewText: I stayed a while ago but was tremendously disappointed in how the prices remained at the Raffles level while the service was definitely Viceroy. The lights in my room did not turn off (my room was $750ish a night). Maintenance had to come in around midnight, yay! I was then moved to a room in the back of the hotel facing the parking lot above the staff break area. They did comp one night but anyone who thinks the property is on par with a Raffles hotel will be in for a surprise. The pool service double charged us billing both my room and my friend's credit card the same amount. Hopefully they have improved since a year ago.
ReviewTitle: This Is Definitely No Longer a Raffles Property

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: Perfect hotel for touring Universal Studios or Warner Bros Studios. We stayed Wed & Thur night with a great Groupon rate. The hotel grounds are beautiful. The Front Yard restaurant is in the front yard. Beautiful trees and bushes surround the hotel premises. The hotel has been updated and looks sharp. Only hotel drawback was one of the elevators in the building we were in was down for upgrading and with only two people working the front desk, I waited for 15 minutes to check out. After waiting that long with the same people at the desk, I left and phoned them to email me my receipt. Other than those two instances, we loved the hotel and would return. Kinda close to the 101 Fwy so we did hear road noise from our room on the East side of the hotel. Oh, and they charged $22 for parking or $27 for valet per day. I guess you gotta pay in LA.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: We weren't sure about the location in Hollywood before we arrived, but quickly realised it was perfect for our LA stay. The location felt safe, and was close to Universal, Warner bros tour, Griffith Observatory and with a free shuttle bus to Universal and also the metro where it was only one metro stop to the Chinese theatre and stars. The hotel is clean and very pretty at night with the lights, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant also serves good food and amazing cocktails.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: We chose the Garland because we were going to Bel Air for jazz one evening, and DTLA for dinner the next evening and it was a central location, especially because we took "Lyft". During the day we walked to Ventura Boulevard, which, offers so much! We were pleasantly surprised that we loved this hotel....we weren't expecting it to be like a boutique hotel....it felt that way. The attention to decorating detail is what I noticed immediately in our room and the restaurant....just look around and you find something interesting to see. Our room 408 was quiet, and away from the elevator, which is what I requested. I loved the bathroom; it was Feng Shui with it's simplicity, no shower curtain, but a great half non-moving glass "door", really clean. We liked and used the very quiet refrigerator in the room. We will stay again.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: Tiny bathroom with the smallest bathroom counter I can remember, tiny closet, designer paint scheme in 1950's orange, and a tiny balcony overlooking a freeway! This place is more like a Hollywood set than a good hotel: all front with the minimum possible in real comfort. And what should have been a lobby entrance was shared with a busy restaurant.
ReviewTitle: Short changes the basics for glitz.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: Being our 7th visit again very impressed, all staff and managers are very friendly, helpful and professional. On arrival you will receive a welcoming greeting. The rooms are spotlessly clean, beds very comfortable. The hotel itself has many amenities including a swimming pool and an excellent Jacuzzi. The Garland is ideally situated on a bus route . It also offers free transportation to Universal studios (very close) the shuttle also stops at the metro station where you can catch the subway direct to the walk of fame and many other places. Will certainly be returning next year.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: The Garland is a wonderful hotel with an Amazing staff,from the front desk to the bell men , valet to the pleasant housekeeping staff! Also The Yard restaurant staff is terrific, the food there is also great and the service is even better my favorite server is Sonia she always has a smile on her face and remembers everyone's name! The Garland makes you feel like you are at home while being away!

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: The room location was in the back of the property with a view of the skylights across the freeway looking at Universal Studios Theme Park. It felt like I had the floor (Third Level) to myself. I wouldn't mind returning to stay again. The reason for the stay was that I attended the USC Vrs Cal game in football and the game ended about 10PM. Home is about a good two hours driving so I opted to stay the night. ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: I have stayed here for years and it keeps getting better. The service is wonderful and the restaurant menu is varied and delicious. I see families playing in the pool all day long. It's great for singles or families and extremely convenient to Universal (they offer a free bus there).

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: i spent a week at the Garland at the end of October and had a wonderful time. The staff was accommodating (I was upgraded to a suite), and the hotel was attractive and comfortable. There were many families staying there, and the Garland has activities and facilities for children.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: I poured over reviews to find the perfect hotel to stay at in the Los Angeles area during my recent trip to California. I spent a couple days in Anaheim and then went to Los Angeles for a few days to visit a friend and check some attractions off of my travel to-do list. The Garland was a perfect location, close to attractions such as Universal Studios and Warner Bros. Studios. The hotel has trolley service to Universal and to the metro station as well. Staff were fantastic and extremely helpful, pleasant from the time I checked in! They were also great and had spot-on suggestions on modes of travel and knew the area well. I also loved the grounds, pool area and room was perfect. It was extremely clean and quiet. I enjoyed breakfast one day at the restaurant on premises and again, staff were friendly. The order came quickly and they have both indoor and outdoor seating (in a very lovely area). Since I had things planned for the time I was there I was not able to partake in the planned events The Garland offers - but the schedule was great and they have activities such as movies at the pool, yoga, walks and game nights. I will definitely stay here again when I travel to the area!
ReviewTitle: First stay here - will DEFINITELY return!

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: We had an early flight from LAX so decided to stay close to the airport the night before. Staff was welcoming, hotel and rooms were great. Added bonus were the Starbucks and ZPizza in the same building! Had pizza, great night sleep(quiet), coffee in the AM, took their shuttle(runs even r20 minutes) to the terminal and off we went. Hotel does offer a breakfast we did not have because of early departure.

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: We stayed one night at the Residence Inn/El Segundo on our way to Hawaii. We arrived mid afternoon, and were upgraded to a two bedroom suite so that we could have a room that was ready upon arrival. We called the shuttle from LAX, and they arrived within minutes to pick us up. The driver was very courteous. Upon arrival at the hotel, we met the manager of the hotel, who was extremely nice to us. It was explained that we had been upgraded so that we would have a room that was ready since it was not check-in time as of yet. We appreciated this so much after a long flight. There was a queen size bed in each bedroom, along with a separate living room/kitchen. Each bedroom had a TV and a bathroom, and the living room also had a separate TV. The kitchen was a full size which would be very helpful under other circumstances. However, we were only staying overnight with an early flight the next morning. There was a fast food restaurant right around the corner which served us very well. The hotel does have evening food available on Monday-Wednesday I believe. But, with the time change, this really didn't work for us. The only negative I can say about this hotel is that the walls were a little thin, and we did hear some noise from the next room and the hallway. Other than that, this would be a five star facility.

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: My husband and I spent 3 nights here. It was a fantastic experience. Check in was quick. The front desk staff were very friendly and even gave us a complimentary upgrade. The room was clean and the view of the airport was great! Having a pizza place, sub shop, and Starbucks on the main level was really convenient and the food was great! Free breakfast was a plus! Perfect stay.

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: We had an overnight stay on our way to Tahiti. The saying location location location is so true. They have pillow toppers and a great breakfast buffet as well as 5 minute provided shuttle. The staff was friendly though their mile walk to a pharmacy turned out to more like two miles, but the direction was right. We enjoyed our stay and the rooms were big with complete kitchens if you need that.

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: We stayed here in September for a night when we were on our way to Cabo, but we stayed here a week when I visited my husband in LA. I find it very interesting that we were placed in the exact same room on the 10th floor. With 12 floors and it being the week of Christmas I find that for that to be a coincidence defies statistical odds, but that is another subject. The stay was nice, but when I turned up the heat to 76 degrees in the room, only cold air came from the vent. That certainly would not warm up the room. We called down and they sent up maintenance. He found that the level of some fluid was down to 80 something and it should have been up to 110 or so. He filled up the level, but it blew warmer air for sometime after he left, but not for long. Then we were back to the same. Since I called down for a blanket, I just left that issue alone. Yes, I needed some heat at night in LA over the Christmas 2016 holiday. But other than that, the room was the size that we like with a sofa, refrigerator, kitchenette, microwave, and sink. I do like that even for Christmas there was not a roudy night or any noise. And when we first arrived, you could hear voices from the next room, but once inside you could not, so that is a definite plus. They do have free breakfast, but there was not a good selection on Saturday morning and it was crowded so we went to the Original Pancake House. That was much better. They have a selection of foods that you can microwave (which is helpful late at night), but no restaurant on site. Overall it was a nice stay. We stayed a week and felt that they should have kept the Friday night at the same rate since we spending more than $1100 to stay there (a mere difference of less than $40). While a night is a night and they don't care who pays the higher rate (us or another guest) the fact that we had stayed a week should have made them think of the value of customer service and not that the less than $40 would trump the ability for us to have a great customer service experience, especially in light of the heat vent issue. It was nice, but I will choose another hotel on the strip because of that issue. There is too much competition for any hotel not to consistently deliver high customer satisfaction results. It does impact the bottom line, which most companies still don't see. So that $40 probably cost them more than several thousand as I will stay at another hotel on my next two visits. Oh, parking is $24, which is steep. Next time I will opt for free parking and not free breakfast since the free breakfast offerings are slim ad I have been to a hotel with free breakfast on several occasions that had a huge selection and prepared well.

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: Nice and modern room with full kitchen (complete with big fridge, utensils, microwave), big sofa and TV, massive king bed, big bathrom with closet and good shower. Very clean overall. Otherwise, its a very pleasant stay, and i would stay again. Free shuttles provided too and no problem in catching it

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
ProviderLocation: 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5471 5933 W. Century Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5471
ReviewText: This is a great hotel near the airport with frequent shuttles (with friendly drivers) to the airport. Rooms are large and well lit - the one I had was a suite with kitchen area. ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard

ProviderName: Residence Inn Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard

ReviewText: We recently stayed at the Hotel Erwin and enjoyed our stay very much. The location of the hotel is perfect. ProviderLocation: 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles , CA 90291-3613 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles, CA 90291-3613

ReviewTitle: I wish I liked it more.

ProviderLocation: 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles , CA 90291-3613 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles, CA 90291-3613
ReviewText: This is an excellent hotel located right in Venice beach, a block away from the beach and a short walk to Abbott Kinney, which is a must visit if you like shopping! The hotel offers free passes to spin and yoga classes and has bikes on site that you can take out for a stroll. Our hotel room was huge with a separate living room and dining room area. We would definitely stay here again!

ProviderLocation: 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles , CA 90291-3613 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles, CA 90291-3613
ReviewText: I have written books about where to stay and where to eat in Europe. Sometimes I find small secret hideaways and I choose not to tell. Because it's a secret I want to keep to myself and close friends. If you travel the coast of Europe you will find escapes, restaurants, hotels, hideaways almost anywhere and everywhere where there is a place to enjoy what nature has given us. If you travel the long coastline of the United States of America very few such places can be found. That is what this hidden gem, "hotel Erwin," is all about... life on the beach in comfort, life on the beach with a view, life on the beach in the middle of Venice, life on the beach in California. Live life if only for a weekend and you will remember. Have you ever dreamt about having a Californian Beach house... I have ! Well there is no need to dream anymore. It's here. Have you ever dreamt about sitting on a roof deck with the younger generation, music, and surfers and watch the California sunset. Well, there is no need to dream anymore. It's here.
ReviewTitle: Don't tell anyone, let this place be my secret

ReviewText: Though the weather was not . The staff, Joey and Catalina at the front desk were amazing with suggestions for the rainy day. The Barlo ☕️ & breakfast is amazing. A must try. Though the Rooftop experience was not available due to weather. We will defend try again.

ProviderLocation: 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles , CA 90291-3613 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles, CA 90291-3613
ReviewText: For staying at Venice beach, I don't think there is any cooler location. What great views I had, even from my room, and seeing both the beach and boardwalk brought a smile to my face. There were a couple of glitches with my room and the hotel staff made it good and definitely I will want to go back! Recommended.

ProviderLocation: 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles , CA 90291-3613 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles, CA 90291-3613
ReviewText: I got geo-targeted with an ad for Hotel Erwin when I was using my hotel tonight app. It was the nicest hotel by far that was being offered for under or around $200 a night. When I checked in, it seemed to me that the rooms popping up on hotels tonight are the remaining rooms they can't sell during the week so they put up on hotels tonight day-of...those happen to be the big rooms with beautiful ocean views. Well, that's what happened to me at least. My $200 room was clearly more like a $500 room. The staff was so accommodating and made great recommendations for organic fresh Mexican food a few doors down and then the hotel bar served me up a late night cocktail that I took up to my room and sat on my deck watching the lights across the southern coast and Venice neighborhood. Great neighborhood to explore day and night. I stopped upstairs to check out the roof deck. It's enormous and has a great ocean and city view. Tons of seating and I'm sure it's packed in better weather. Even though it was cold and sparsely occupied the night I went upstairs they were spinning some great music and good cocktails. I'm pretty picky and maybe I was just at the place at the right time, but from my perspective, that was a great hotel visit at any price.

ProviderLocation: 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles , CA 90291-3613 1697 Pacific Avenue, Venice Beach , Los Angeles, CA 90291-3613
ReviewText: While I wouldn't say that the hotel is wonderful it is a good place to stay if visiting Venice Beach. It's extremely close to the beach and an easy walk from all the key "must sees". The roof top bar is also great, with wonderful views of the coast. The food in the bar downstairs is top notch bar food. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall the rooms are nice and clean, although nothing too fancy. On the negative side the elevator is very slow so when the bar is busy on the roof there can be a bit of a wait. The only thing that was a very big negative is that each corridor there is piped music playing. Unfortunately this isn't turned off at night so on my first night I was woken up by the speaker outside my room. Not very loud but enough to wake me up. I bought ear plugs which sorted that problem on the second night!

ProviderLocation: 1717 Vine St , Los Angeles , CA 90028-5248 1717 Vine St , Los Angeles, CA 90028-5248
ReviewText: Is the Redbury a boisterous nightclub? Or a 4-star hotel catering to their guest’s needs? Unfortunately for us, it couldn’t and shouldn’t try to be both. This hurt what could have been an smooth stay and an easy recommendation. My wife and I chose The Rebury because it was in walking distance (no easy feat) to the Metro, coffee shops, and a Trader Joe’s. The latter was great because it meant we could utilize the large kitchenette in our room. Weeks prior, we politely requested a suite away from any avoidable noise. We’re well-traveled and fine with city din and keenly aware that we were near the famous or infamous Hollywood and Vine, so we were given a room that faced the street – and sadly, the Avalon nightclub next door. Needless to say, being in close proximity to a nightclub meant we heard the crowd, the drums, and the DJ until late. Even with being out late ourselves. Another room was offered the next day. This time facing inward to their courtyard where we knew the Redbury’s own The Library was situated. An indoor/outdoor lounge we were assured would either be not open because of weather (true for the Friday we were there) or not open late. Well, at 1:40am on Saturday, the music was still going, so we called to complain. The sheepish desk help said it would be over soon. Not good enough. We lost sleep and our tempers. The courtyard worked as an echo chamber pushing the music up to us at nearly full-volume. Funnily enough, we actually liked the playlist, but wanted to hear it on our terms especially when paying a nightly fee. We received an apology and an acknowledgement that noise is a constant complaint. No shock there. And they had no answer as to how sound-proofing the door, but not the windows made any sense. In the end, no discount, rebate or comp was offered from the front desk for the inconveniences. It’s a real shame because the rooms (with balconies) are very clean and spacious. The kitchenette is complete with gas burners, a fridge, a microwave and utensils. The location was perfect. At least for us. The suite was quite quiet when the lounge was closed. And the staff were warm, albeit not very helpful in the end. We were told that the hotel is closing in July and may reopen without the bar downstairs. That’s good. As it saves me the bother of telling you to keep your hard-earned money until the Redbury stops pleasing no one by trying to please everyone.

ReviewText: Stayed at the Roosevelt on Grammy Weekend, and the Roosevelt continues to be one of the most convenient and accessible hotels in Hollywood. It's walking distance from most attractions, has the best parking, and the fastest valet crew. The lobby bar becomes a hotspot at night, much like the Hollywood W. The rooms are cozy, clean and well stocked. Will definitely stay here again.
ReviewTitle: One of the best in Hollywood

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: Lobby is stunning with loads of old tile and a really great vibe. Room (at least ours) is TINY and sadly, you can't look out the window which is frosted over. That's the only real reason for a less than 5 star review. Parking is $42 a night, so plan accordingly.

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: We arrived here after a bad experience at another hotel had forced us to change hotels. They say every cloud has a silver lining and this truly was one. We arrived after midnight, tired and miserable after our previous experience. The gentleman on reception, Forrest, was amazing and did everything he could to help get us in a room quickly despite some confusion over the booking (our previous hotel had only booked us one night rather than two) There was a pool party going on that night and so Forrest put us in a quiet room in the tower so we could rest then very kindly said we could transfer to a pool cabana room the following day. This all happened seamlessly and after spending the following day looking around LA we came back to find all our luggage moved to the most beautiful room overlooking the pool. We were unlucky to find ourselves in LA during a very rainy couple of days which meant we didn't get a chance to use the pool or spend an evening at the pool bar, but all the same the room was sensational and the overall experience was fantastic. I can't recommend this place highly enough, from the staff to the rooms, the great cocktails in the bar and the excellent location, you really can't beat it. I won't stay anywhere else in LA now.

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: Overall this is an excellent option and I would stay again. Pros: 1) location could not be better; 2) it is a beautiful building, you feel like in a movie; 3) very good options on bars and restaurants inside the hotel; 4) very good rooms, clean and functional; 5) free wifi; 6) very friendly staff at front desk. Cons: 1) parking is extremely expensive, 2) they charged me for consumption in the room after I left the hotel, which was not correct, and took about three weeks to correct; 3) elevators take forever to arrive, just two small to cover all the hotel.
ReviewTitle: Excellent hotel, with few points to improve

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: We had the best time here! Such a gorgeous hotel with a prime location! The staff was absolutely amazing, and Jasmine at the front desk went above and beyond to make our weekend extremely special, as we were celebrating a very happy occasion. I don't have a single complaint about this stunning property

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: Excellent location, right across the Kodak theater Room was very spacious, modern comfortable and clean room Tried a few restaurants, all were really great. Breakfast at the 25 degrees were particularly nice, I went there twice. All staff were friendly and helpful Hotel toiletries were not the typical boring big brands one but some stylish brands. You can get everything you need here, a hotel with history but modern full refurbished rooms, restaurants and bars with loads of characters and themes

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: Arrived early due after 36 hrs travel from Perth, had notified hotel. Told no room till 3, nowhere to go- despite paying above the odds to stay in this hotel i could not use the pool as they were having a pool party. Is it just me...or when u pay for a hotel and pool, the pool should be primarily for guests! Don't get me wrong, I'm not a Spoil sport I love a pool party....but I just feel when I pay above the odds for the stay at famous Roosevelt I at least deserve somewhere in the most far away corner of the pool away from the bikinis, louboutins and fake eyelashes to wait for a room. Room itself is so small you literally can't open your case, very basic!!! Put my do not disturb sign on the door to sleep off the jetlag, despite the sign both housekeeping AND mini bar tried to get in the room waking me up. This happened two days in a row, resulting in one very grouchy little The bar closed really early too but the cocktails, in fairness, were amazing and the staff in the bar really friendly.

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: Whenever I am able to find myself fortunate enough to be in Los Angeles I stay at The Hollywood Roosevelt. I am usually able to stay in a cabana room and for the first time on this most recent trip I stayed in a poolside cabana. I will definitely try to stay in a poolside cabana again in the future. The main reason I choose to stay at The Hollywood Roosevelt is because I enjoy the atmosphere and design, but being able to be in the epicenter of Hollywood is great too. I can't wait to get back again.
ReviewTitle: Another Great Night at The Hollywood Roosevelt

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: I stayed at The Hotel Roosevelt in December for 4 days. Was a friendly hotel people were helpful. My room was upgraded it was huge. Clean. My view overlooked the Hollywood Blvd I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Los Angeles

ProviderLocation: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel) 7000 Hollywood Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6003 (Formerly Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel)
ReviewText: Location cannot be beat. Service from everyone, front desk, housekeeping, 25 Degrees restaurant, etc. all top quality. Room was well-planned in layout and design. Toiletries very high end. Wifi worked well. Restoration of lobby to original 1920s look is incredible and authentic since they found and used the architect's original blueprints. This property is managed very well, and it shows. Kudos to whoever is in charge for running a well-oiled machine.” Special thanks to Allyson and Bre, guest relations execs, and to Paul in "25 Degrees" (in-house restaurant)

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: I've now stayed several times at the Intercontinental in Century City, just outside Beverly Hills and every time I enjoy it more - so much so it's now my favorite LA hotel. Although I'm a classic "old glamour" hotel lover (a huge fan of the Langham in Pasadena, Hotel Bel Air, The Beverly Hills Hotel, etc.) I now prefer the Intercontinental over all of the more well-known Five Star hotels. The location - just around the corner from Beverly Hills but also just a short drive to the beach in Santa Monica or to the Palisades, is great. The staff are really wonderful, and the restaurant which has been recently renovated, is comfortable, classy and they serve an amazing brunch. The rooms (and especially the beds) are super comfortable - some with views over the Fox studio and all the way to the ocean (on a clear day). The pool isn't a "scene" like at some hotels, but is big, relaxing, and great for swimming laps. It's an all-around great LA hotel. In fact, I think I'll visit again soon...
ReviewTitle: Wonderful gem of a hotel in a very convenient location

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: My husband and I stayed here one night on a layover between the midwest and Asia. It had the perfect mix of things to do (two restaurants, small spa) and quiet. Our one and only complaint was quickly and professionally addressed. Would definitely return.

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: We got a deal and stayed at the Intercontinental in Century City. We arrived at 9pm. The deal included breakfast. It it wasn't on our reservation.The manager was very kind and gave us vouchers. The hotel was beautiful and the sent of green tea was piped into the lobby. There were roses everywhere. The room was very comfortable. Breakfast was a 5 star affair for every culture. Japanese, Mediterranean, Jewish and all American. The staff were superb! We will return and became Intercontinental members. Stayed at one in Tel Aviv and it was also fabulous!

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: Beautiful hotel, fantastic staff with exemplary service. A lovely room but rather surprised at the lack of bathroom amenities. Other Intercontinental hotels have always had superb amenities - this place did not even offer a shower cap!

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: I got a killer deal on Priceline for this room. The hotel is in a business area so on the weekend it was very quite. Very close to Fox and CAA. It's about a 30 minute walk to Rodeo Drive. It was a 20 dollar uber ride from the airport. You could get to Weho or Westwood for around 10 dollars. Like any Intercontinental, the room service and minibar were expensive but they did provide free water and coffee. The restaurant was decent for a quick snack or a drink but I'd recommend venturing to one of the other places in Beverly Hills if you want dinner. Staff was very polite and helpful. There is a hotel car service that will bring you to nearby places for free or a very low cost depending on distance. The concierge is very helpful with reservations and tips on where to go. Overall great experience.

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: The InterContinental Los Angeles Century City is a superb property. Every aspect of the quality and service provided is top notch. As a long time member of the InterContinental Hotel Group (IHG), I almost always receive a free room upgrade upon check-in and free WI-FI is also included. I usually select the reservation that includes breakfast because the buffet breakfasts offered are beyond superb, and offer a plethora of delicious items for the discerning traveler. The breakfast buffet is indeed intercontinental and the dishes offered to guests are dishes which will meet the tastes of the international traveler. Without reserve, the InterContinental Los Angeles Century City provides absolutely superb service to each guest and visitor.

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: Received a first class experience all the way from the valet to the room service! The property is very swank, rooms are large and beds are heavenly. The bathroom was slightly dated, however was very clean and well maintained. I can't wait to visit again next time I am in LA.

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: I went for a facial at the Spa. The facial was great. It is a pleasant setting and the lady was very professional and nice. I didn't use all the facilities afterwards, just the steam room which was supposed to be eucalyptus, there was no eucalyptus, however, it was big and very nice.

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: Whether business or leisure , the estabished hotel team is making you feel home ! Great experience. Personalized hospitality and refreshing amenities . This hotel maintains the highest standard of conduct in all actions.

ProviderLocation: 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles , CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel) 2151 Avenue of the Stars , Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
ReviewText: Great location, Lysia at check in was beautiful with communication skill set, professionalism, and poised. Dinning yesterday 10/11/2016 was just okay compared to prior breakfast 10/10 which was an excellent experience coupled with awesome customer service. I recommend this hotel for both business and leisure.

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: We stayed here for 3 nights. We felt that you certainly pay for the location. We loved the location amidst the luxury stores and there were amazing cars everywhere we looked! The rooms are quite small and certainly dated, considering the cost of our stay. However, we did think it was good value to buy the breakfast daily at the hotel. Also, the bed in our room was uncomfortably soft.

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: We stayed 3 nights and found our stay to be extremely pleasant. I thoroughly enjoyed The penthouse gyme which is on the roof top in the open overlooking Beverly Hills The staff are extremely obliging and go above and beyond. Furniture could do with a makeover in bedrooms
ReviewTitle: Good Value Great location Exceptional Service

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: So Kind And welcome and we did an Early check in du to GO PATS Game and we won .. Than the did make a reservation at Pump to us Just loved it Best hotel on Rodeo Drive We felt very welcome Good drinks free Champagne

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: We had a great time at our stay at the Luxe Rodeo Dr. All the employees were very gracious and kind. The hotel is located right on Rodeo Drive, so if you're looking for a beautiful location, you will love it here. It is a lovely stroll with all the shops and boutiques. We enjoyed the nightly complimentary cocktail bar, the morning breakfast and the light bites. All were included in the resort fee. We were assured to have an exceptional experience by our reservationist, Edward. He set up everything for us. All of our restuarant reservations and gave us an ample choice of things to do while in the city. He was very professional and geniune. We will definately be back for another stay. Our only regret is that we didn't plan a longer stay!

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: Everything was about as perfect as it gets - a warm welcome at the front desk, room clean, bathroom sparkling, bed comfortable with premium linens, very adequate breakfast... Moderate pricing. What more could one ask for?
ReviewTitle: A real gem in the heart of Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: Rooms were very nice and clean except for the very noisy aircon! At times in the middle of the night you could hear the cars outside! Excellent service most specially the staff at the lounge and front entrance!

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: Quaint, intimate lobby. Awesome staff!! All staff members were engaging and eager to please. There are daily comp beverages (alcohol & coffee, beer, wine, water), appetizers, breakfast in the lounge. Quite a sense of community is created fairly quickly. The exercise room is small but all major muscles can be worked. The cardio equipment is outside on the rooftop... amazing experience with a view of the hills - as long as the weather is cooperative. The elevator is SLLLLOOOOOWWWW. but not a deal breaker. There was an unpleasant odor on the 4th floor hallway. My sense of smell is very muted... typically if I can smell something then it is strong to others. Nothing appeared unclean... but the smell was there... "old dank attic type"... The bed and linens were lovely. Had a king room.. not much "extra" space in room. A chair with desk and reading chair were present but I didn't use either. I was there for work... once I returned to the room I was mentally ready for slumber. The air conditioner worked well but had a loud blower. I was forced to turn the TV volume up 6-8 levels when it came on.
ReviewTitle: Boutique hotel, attentive staff surrounded by couture shops

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: I arrived at midnight but was greeted by a very courteous night manager. He notified me that I had been upgraded from a standard room to a junior suite. The suite was beautiful, with entry to a private courtyard and ample amenities. I also enjoyed the hotel breakfasts. Although my schedule did not permit, there are appetizers and cocktails served during part of the afternoon and evening. The location is superb, and the staff is helpful. I would definitely stay there again.
ReviewTitle: Great location, helpful staff, spacious rooms

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: I booked Luxe Rodeo Drive based on other very positive reviews and was not disappointed! The rooms were nice, and quiet. Staff was great and were always there to help you if you needed it. The location was incredible. I walked everywhere and would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.
ReviewTitle: Great Hotel in the heart of Beverly Hills!

ProviderLocation: 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210 360 N Rodeo Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210
ReviewText: The Luxe Rodeo is a pleasant and quiet hotel. The staff is friendly and capable. The facilities are adequate, but it is an older hotel - once a nursing facility of some sort reinvented as a Rodeo Drive Hotel. The rooms are unremarkable, but clean and comfortable. While close to the Peninsula and Montage, it is a much different type of accommodation. There are none of the amenities you would expect to find in a Beverly Hills hotel, but there are restaurants all other necessary services very close by. What makes the Luxe Rodeo attractive are somewhat lower rates than their local competitors and best of all, it is right on Rodeo Drive in the very middle of Beverly Hills, which can be helpful.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North

ReviewText: Stayed here overnight after a late flight arrival and an early departure the next morning. Had a nice drink and a sandwich in the bar. Quiet room, good night's sleep. We would use this hotel agas n if we were traveling through LA
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel for a quick night between flights

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: Stayed for 2 nights and needed a place close to the airport as well as Hollywood and Beverly Hills. The room was spacious and we loved having a living space and a sleeping space. Breakfast was great and the Cocktails where a nice bonus. Clean rooms and although we had a lovely view of a wall in an alley and the dumpsters we only needed a place to sleep really so it wasn't a problem. A little loud in the mornings when the dumpsters where picked up. Our only gripe was that the bar closed at 11 am and food options in the hotel itself were limited. We will stay again because the price was excellent and the breakfast was great but if you want something that has more options or a resort atmosphere there are better choices.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: At night, when most ready to rest, having to waiti for promised shuttle service from the airport on two occasions was infuriating. Need to track drivers better or manage the current drivers for their needs. If you can get to the hotel, the rest was to be expected.
ReviewTitle: Nice rooms, undependble airport shuttle service especially at night

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: We have stayed here before because we can count on this hotel to be near the airport and have comfortable beds. Service is excellent and the complimentary breakfast is very good. The rooms are nice but a bit dark. In the suite we had I noticed the water pressure wasn't too good. Otherwise it was a very satisfactory stay.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: My wife & I stayed here recently one night after flying into LAX. Price & TripAdvisor ratings were the main reason we chose this hotel. We used their free shuttle from the airport which we waited about 15-20 minutes for. The hotel is big & spacious as was the room. It was clean enough but the entire place just seemed to be a little outdated with 70's-like decor. I think if they'd do a complete overhaul this could really be a nice hotel. Regardless our stay was fine and breakfast the next morning was sufficient. Depending on the price we might stay here again the next time we're in LA.
ReviewTitle: Good Stay But Hotel Is Dated

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: Snagged a good deal, so not bad. Nice thing about Embassy /suites is that they are consistent. But the bigger ones have a more upscale feel and this one was more mid-size. Room fine, but noisy from traffic. Hotel was not full; there were quieter sides of hotel and a Juliet balcony, while a nice touch couldn't really be used in cool February weather plus window let in the road noise. Bedroom window, so I thought about the pull out couch - but not seriously. Housekeeping changed a bulb without my even asking - ES is generally very on top of that stuff (a plus). The soap on the other hand was of the 'silky soft' type that you simply cannot wash off. Following stay was a Doubletree - fortunately a different provider there! No breakfast meat choice unless you had ham cubes in the omelet, an omission. Airport location is isolated although super convenient for flying, and in future I'd opt for something in MDR.
ReviewTitle: large room at a budget price

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: The staff from the front desk to Food and Beverage Services provided top-notch customer service from the time I checked into the hotel. Jaime at the front desk took special care to ensure the details of my stay was adequate. Marie Blomquist the Food and Beverage Director and Eva the Bartender provided excellent customer services. They were very attentive to my requests and worked well together as a team. The food I ordered was of good quality, served fast and hot. The overall experience at this location was above standards. And I can't help but mention the technology at this location was surprisingly new. The onsite "Winnie" the robot was advanced technology I haven't seen at other hotels. I will stay at this location again.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: in town for a few days for usc vs notre dame. this hotel is clean. staff is super friendly. breakfast was decent. about 1 mile from lax, which makes it ultra convenient. free shuttle to/from airport. one complaint: while waiting for the shuttle, I saw 4-5 shuttles for other hotels before seeing one for this hotel. actually had to call the hotel to double check that a shuttle was offered. if you're venturing deep into los angeles, this hotel is a bit far. be prepared to rent a car or spend $ on uber or lyft.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North

ReviewText: Great hotel! Great staff! Great experience! Great location! Truly enjoyed the trip and stay. Staff very friendly and helpful. Facility very clean. Hotel decorations very pleasing especially the chandeliers. Elevators smooth and quick to respond. Cafe pleasant with good service and good food. Enjoyed the Robot gift shop delivery service. Fantastic idea and very efficient.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton LAX North
ProviderLocation: 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90045-5407 9801 Airport Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90045-5407
ReviewText: I know that the Westin is famous for its Heavenly Bed, but after a month away, travelling in Ethiopia and Italy, my bed at the Embassy Suites LAX North felt heavenly. I checked in late and Lucy, at the front desk, went out of her way to accomodate me. The room was spacious, clean comfortable - in a word, heavenly. The breakfast, as always, was delicious. As i live north of San Diego, I frequently fly in and out of LAX and often need to overnight there. I have tried several of the hotels in the area, but this will now be my goto place.

ProviderLocation: 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028

ProviderLocation: 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Very impressed with everyone I met at the Loews Hollywood. Staying at the Loews again when I return in April. The gentleman who checked me in, Donald, was wonderful. Thank you for helping to make my visit to Hollywood perfect in every way.
ReviewTitle: What a great place to stay in Hollywood!
