ReviewText: I enjoyed staying in this hotel. The location is the best, right in the middle of Hollywood walk of fame. Rooms are confortable and clean, but no free bottles of water, only at charge. Breakfasts are good, but expected more choice of food

ProviderLocation: 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: I was only staying in LA for one night so I selected this hotel for the convenient location near many restaurants / nightlife in Hollywood. The hotel was not cheap but it was definitely cheaper than some of the other hotels in Hollywood so it seemed like a good value relative. My room had a view of the pool on the 5th floor but unfortunately I did not have the opportunity to use the pool. I think in an ideal world I would rate the hotel somewhere between 3 and 4 stars, the room was decently comfortable though nothing special. You're definitely paying for location in this area.

ProviderLocation: 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: Loews Hollywood cannot be beaten on its location, its style, its comfort and its staff. Situation just moments away from the middle of Hollywood Walk of Fame, it makes getting around Hollywood a breeze. The hotel was modern and had everything you could possibly need. Comfortable, large rooms. The staff came across as genuinely friendly, as opposed to the fake hospitality you can receive in some hotel locations. They always had a smile on their face and were willing to help with anything. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, no matter how much it would cost me. Perfect hotel.

ProviderLocation: 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles , CA 90028 1755 N Highland Ave , Hollywood , Los Angeles, CA 90028
ReviewText: It's a 4 star stay with fast wifi I only stayed 1 night dogs were barking outside a bit annoying. Very nice Minnie bar. Sadly I won't be returning to this location the valet is nice and the front desk was helpful. This is a beautiful location I suggest give it a try and hope you didn't get the same vibe / experience I did.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: We've stayed at this BW before in a Sandard Double Queen room. We like to stay here overnight when going to Beverly Hills for an evening out. This time, we opted to upgrade to a Junior Suite with a city view and balcony since we were celebrating a belated Valentines Day. Bad choice. Our Junior Suite cost an additional $100 per night. There was no city view; only a view of the apartment buildings across the street. The buildings obstructed the city view into LA. The room was in dire need of a refurbishing. The upholstery on the furniture was worn, dirty and smelled bad. The carpeting was old, stained, and tattered. The balcony was dirty with a rusted bistro table and two chairs, one lounge and very old and stained cushions. The entire balcony hadn't been cleaned or swept in quite some time. The bathroom needed an upgrade and a rebath. There was a soaking jaccuzi tub with a shower head on the wall; a very strange combination. I imagine that it would have been slippery and dangerous to take a shower. Fortunately, the hotel was not sold out and we were able to switch to a Standard King room. We were quite pleased with the change in rooms, and had a very nice stay. Upon checking out, we had to intervene at the front desk when the front desk clerk was planning to charge us for the Junior Suite instead of the Standard King room. An unnecessary mistake. All in all, we were pleased and will return in the future to a Standard Room.

ReviewText: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and, because we're gold members (no charge for collecting points for stays), they upgraded us to a sweet suite! The hotel is clean and comfy, includes breakfast, has laundry and parking ($18 per night to park indoors). And it's in a fun and central location. There's an outdoor pool in a pretty courtyard, a business center and, I'd imagine but didn't check, a workout room. Highly recommended.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: We had such a wonderful stay at this charming hotel for two nights. We had a King Room with a balcony and the balcony was marvelous! Plants and flowers plus seating group made it so welcoming. The hotel had such great charm due to its European feel. Breakfast was great. We also ran across the street for dinner...loved the convenience. Helpful staff, a place to print boarding pass, hot breakfast included, balcony, and charm--couldn't ask for anything more!

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: If you are a walker, this hotel is well located for visiting some of LA's main attractions. We were able to wall to the Walk of Fame and the Chinese Theater, the Beverly Center, the Grove and the La Brea tar pits from here. The hotel itself is charming with well appointed rooms. Ours overlooked the pool which was surrounded by flowers. There are two breakfast areas, both serving almost the same thing, so there was never a problem getting a table.
ReviewTitle: Charming well located hotel with old Hollywood vibe

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: My husband & I enjoyed our time when we stayed here. There's nothing super fancy about it but we weren't looking for fancy. There is a good handful of places within walking distance. We took an Uber to Hollywood Blvd (I think it was $6.00) and walked the streets for a couple of hours taking in the sights and shopping. We decided to walk back to the hotel which was kind of far but we were not in a hurry and there were a few places we wanted to stop at on the way back, so it can be done. Always allow extra time to get to where you need to go. If your map/phone tells you it's 10 minutes to your destination, give yourself and extra 15 minutes. We actually enjoyed our visits to sit in front of the hotel and watch the cars go by. We saw a couple of "drag races" right there on Sunset between 2 Lamborghini's. People watching is always great entertainment too.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: My Mom died 2 days ago...I was and remain devastated. Best Western Sunset Plaza saved me from grief. SO kind they are. My room is beautiful. Flat screen TV, beautiful king bed with a soft feather comforter. A fridge, a dual bath/shower. And Mark Pope and Jesse Moreno and Theresa at the front desk are so warm, so kind. Breakfast is delicious and you will be in the heart of West Hollywood, California.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: I couldn't have asked for more beautiful surroundings, friendlier staff or better location. Sunset Boulevard is full of charming bars, delicious restaurants and is close to Santa Monica blvd, (West Hollywood) - a cool area with parks, museums, galleries and bars. The hotel was nice and clean with great and helpful staff and the rooms are big and cozy. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and I am already planning my next visit!
ReviewTitle: Charming and relaxing hotel in my favorite LA neighborhood

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Sunset Plaza Hotel
ProviderLocation: 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood , CA 90069-1910 8400 Sunset Blvd , West Hollywood, CA 90069-1910
ReviewText: I visited West Hollywood in July for 8 nights and stayed at the Andaz and gave it a great review. When I was planning my trip for this month I checked the prices there and then called the Sunset Plaza which was over a hundred dollars less a night. Since the purpose of my visit was to visit my grandson I figured I would not be spending that much time in the room so I booked the Sunset Plaza. I was very pleasantly surprised. Although the outside and lobby of the hotel is not as nice as the Andaz the room was great. The amenities in the room were better as there was a microwave, coffee machine, microwave and huge makeup mirror. None of these were in my room at the Andaz. The pool area was amazing. It was so beautiful and relaxing. The included breakfast buffet had so many different choices. I am not a breakfast eater but I could not resist the tempting offerings. The hotel is surrounded by luxury hotels charging hundreds of dollars more per night The Sunset Plaza Best Western is a bargain. I plan to stay there on all of my trips to LA.
ReviewTitle: great hotel at a reasonable price

ReviewText: Very clean and well kept. Good location and nice coffee shop. Parking is convenient and the best part was great front desk service! The cookies were good and everything was solid. We'll definitely stay there again.

ProviderName: Courtyard Los Angeles Century City/Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90064-2538 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90064-2538
ReviewText: Staff were amazing at this place and thats what made it great. Their advice in getting around was brilliant. Breakfast was of good standard and rooms were good although bit pricey for what you get but overall a decent hotel. Would recommend if your staying here for a few days before you move on just like we did.

ProviderName: Courtyard Los Angeles Century City/Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90064-2538 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90064-2538
ReviewText: I have stayed at this hotel property several times and generally have been satisfied with the stay. However, this stay (Sept 28-Oct 2) was not quite up to my expectations. The room I booked was to be a king bed room but I was given a two double bed room that was relatively small compared to those I have had for past stays. I didn't complain but should have. The room was on the Olympic Blvd side of the hotel and was very noisy especially during rush hours. It was OK noise wise at night and I slept OK. The room has a small refrigerator that was only sort of cool when I arrived so I adjusted the temperature control to a cooler setting (adjustment knob on the back of the frig) and it was cold for a while but then went back to being only slightly cool. Since the hotel doesn't offer breakfast my wife and I generally eat a quick breakfast in the room and the frig didn't keep our milk cold at all. During our stay the elevator was either broken or working only very slowly and we ended up taking the stairs up to the third floor most of the time. The fitness room consists of two treadmills and an elliptical machine, some dumbell weights and an exercise bench. I believe it also had a recumbent bike machine. The treadmills and elliptical worked great but the ceiling fans weren't sufficient to keep the room air fresh in the late afternoon. The open air fitness room was pleasant first thing in the morning. The location remains a plus for me since my son lives about 0.7 miles away. Santa Monica, downtown LA, Beverly Hills and many other attractions are close by. Fox Studios is right around the corner. There is a 9 hole golf course not far away and a lovely LA park with a walking/running trail around the perimeter. So, this property remains on my recommended list but could use some attention to details. We will stay here again but mainly for the convenience.
ReviewTitle: A convenient location for Los Angeles touring

ProviderName: Courtyard Los Angeles Century City/Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90064-2538 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90064-2538
ReviewText: This is a typical Courtyard hotel. It's location is the best thing about it. You can walk to Century City Mall and to any of the office buildings on the Avenue of the Stars in Century City. Sure beats having to find a parking space. Tip: The hotel sits on Olympic Blvd which is one of the main East/West routes thru Los Angeles -- it creates a lot of noise. So request a room on the backside of the hotel -- perhaps overlooking the pool area. You won't have to deal with the traffic noise.
ReviewTitle: Mid City Hotel - Close to Century City Mall

ProviderName: Courtyard Los Angeles Century City/Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90064-2538 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90064-2538
ReviewText: Stayed here for a weekend getaway with the wife. Courtyards have always had clean, respectable properties. You know there will be a grill, convenience store, fitness center, and bar. The staff was friendly, and the rooms are clean (you'll never seen mold in a courtyard property). You will need a car to get around and there is a parking fee. Depending on where you plan to go, and what you plan to do, you might be able to find a different Courtyard property with a lower rate. There are several in the L.A area.

ReviewText: The hotel is located in the center of Beverly Hills which is a great location for sightseeing. ReviewText: Staff were very friendly at this hotel and the room was clean. ReviewTitle: Average Hotel, good for short stay.

ProviderName: Courtyard Los Angeles Century City/Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90064-2538 10320 W Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90064-2538
ReviewText: This is my 6th time staying at the Courtyard LA/Century City/BH location and I am a huge fan. If you like me, you like a fridge and microwave in your room. This hotel meets that requirement and on the plus side, there is a huge grocery store across the street to stock up on snacks and drinks if you don't want to purchase them from the hotel. The staff are all nice and the parking/valet attendants have seemed to have been working here since I have been coming (a few years), so that tells you something - the staff like to work here.
ReviewTitle: Good Location. Nice Staff. Added Bonus: Microwave and Fridges inside Rooms!

ReviewText: This property is very clean, modern, with helpful staff. They accommodate cruise passengers and their needs. The views are amazing with many rooms facing the ocean. Their shuttle to the port was quick and very accommodating.
ReviewTitle: Great hotel, close to Port for cruise

ProviderName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel San Pedro
ProviderLocation: 2800 Via Cabrillo Marina , Los Angeles , CA 90731 (Formerly Marina Hotel Port of Los Angeles/San Pedro) 2800 Via Cabrillo Marina , Los Angeles, CA 90731 (Formerly Marina Hotel Port of Los Angeles/San Pedro)
ReviewText: We stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton for 3 nights pre cruise. We had never been to LA before and had no clue of locations but wanted to avoid packing and repacking multiple times so decided to stay here for the full 3 nights of our stay. We arrived early in the morning at 9am and I had requested an early check in as we had just got off a 14 hour flight from Australia. The hotel was able to provide us with this for which we were most grateful. The lady on reception desk was possibly one of the friendliest and nicest hotel greeters we have ever met. We did the paperwork and received our warm chocolate cookies and went to our room. We also had free wifi due to HHHonors membership. I highly recommend HH Honors and booking direct. In the afternoon I asked the Concierge Ozzy about nearby supermarkets. The only con of this hotel is that it is not within walking distance of shops. However, they do provide complimentary shuttle service to where you need to go subject to their requirements, so Ozzy was happy to drive us to the supermarket to collect a few snacks and wine for our cruise. We had room service one night and the food was good, we also ate in the restaurant on the Friday night and enjoyed the happy hour as well as outstanding entertainment by Musician Charlie who plays every Friday night. The hotel also has a lovely pool area which we didn't use and they provided a complimentary shuttle to the cruise port - just book at reception when you arrive. Although it was a little isolated we took a full day tour of LA on the Thursday and took an Uber to Long Beach on the Friday to look around there so it didn't really matter. We had a standard room which was lovely but we did wish we had booked a Marina View. The Hotel felt like home after 3 days and I would definitely stay there again should I ever cruise out of LA again.

ReviewText: My husband and I stayed here so we could get an early start on the next day's activities. Gigi at check-in was fabulous. Super friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff at dinner and breakfast were very professional. It's hard to put into words, but I felt they take pride in the job they are doing, and that's not always the case in a hotel lobby restaurant. We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it looked nice, and we really appreciated the free parking.

ReviewText: We stayed here for two months during treatment at Cedars-Sinai Hospital. They bent over backwards to rearrange the room for sleeping and working, special diets and other services. Everything was perfect.

ProviderName: Sofitel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90048 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: This is not the best Sofitel in which we have stayed and we were therefore a bit disappointed. The staff were excellent but the hotel is showing its age. Although we upgraded to a Hills view i am not sure the view was worth the extra. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and there was sufficient space in the room for 2 large suitcases. The Beverly Centre is just opposite and although there is currently a lot of work going on inside the shopping centre, nevertheless, there are a lot of shops to look at. There is also another shopping centre diagonally opposite with some good, less expensive stores so there is a wealth of choice. Our biggest disappointment was with the food. We dined in for 2 evening meals and both meals were fairly ordinary. At a hotel that is part of an international chain I expected to be able to have muesli for breakfast and i needed to make my own from what was scattered around the different areas. Basic cereals were in the breakfast area but nuts were over near the kitchen. There was a definite emphasis on eggs and a cooked breakfast. I understand this is what is expected by Americans and this is an American hotel but as part of Accor I expected more.
ReviewTitle: Hotel close to large shopping area

ProviderName: Sofitel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90048 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: Great location for dining, artistic walking and shopping. The first class hotel yet very friendly. I felt personal touches. Everybody at work had a good smile from the front desk to the cleaning staff.
ReviewTitle: Such a sweet spot in LA

ProviderName: Sofitel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90048 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: I went to LA as a tourist after a business trip. I had picked the Sofitel because of the location and the good ratings - and I must say it was a perfect choice. The Hotel is located in Beverly Hills, directly next to Beverly Hills Center, an upscale shopping mall - but also next to a small low price shopping mall with a target supermarket and some fast food restaurants. I live to walk when I am in a new city and LA is certainly not made for walking, but from the Sofitel it is just a short walk to Melrose avenue or the really nice 3rd street. Farmers Market is also close, and I also walked up to the Hollywood Boulevard and even to rodeo drive. If you want to go downtown or to Venice Beach, a taxi stand is directly in front of the hotel. When I arrived, the check in was professional and fast. I loved my room, just the (large and nice) shower could offer a bit more water pressure and warm up faster - probably my biggest complaints. Most important: the bed was perfect - also the working area was good, WLAN was fast and free. The outdoor pool was - despite of the cold month - open and accessible, but not really cozy. I guess that only crazy Germans try to go to the pool in Jan. The Spa was great! I did not try the breakfast, I rarely eat a lot in the morning, but in the lobby you find free coffee and tea in the morning, enough to start the day for me. I used the Concierge service and they really did a good job. All in all I have nothing to complain, a real 5 star hotel which is certainly worth the price
ReviewTitle: Great Hotel at a perfect location

ProviderName: Sofitel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
ProviderLocation: 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90048 8555 Beverly Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: The staff here are very friendly and helpful. I can't speak highly enough of the courtesy and emotional support Raymond at the front desk gave me throughout my stay (I was visiting my mother at Cedars Sinai Medical Center, who was very ill). He upgraded me to a suite on arrival when my room was not ready. Then he made sure I was comfortable throughout my stay, even taking the time to write me a heartfelt note pertaining to my mother's illness. The food in the restaurant was very good for both breakfast (excellent buffet) and dinner (lots of small plates as an option). The beds were very comfortable, although the first bed I had was slightly elevated in the middle due to wear (I stayed in 3 rooms during my 7-day stay). There also were some small discrepancies in the stocking of amenities from suite to suite (e.g. no bath salts in one suite, which I wouldn't have known was a standard amenity if they hadn't been supplied in another suite). The exercise facilities could use some upgrading. For example, they only have one upright cycle, which was out of order one day. I had a good massage at the spa. Wifi is excellent and included in the room price. Newspapers are well-stocked at the concierge desk. The nightclub is lively (there is a drag show every Thursday) and looked fun. I never went to it, but you pass by on the way back from the restaurant. The location is central, but not very scenic. Definitely request a "hillside room," unless you want to look at the massive and ugly facade of a shopping center. The location was great for me, as it's just a couple blocks walk to Cedars Sinai.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: Overall, this was a decent hotel. It's relatively clean, has a vintage atmosphere, and it's hard to beat the price in Beverly Hills. However, I was shocked to find it was missing several basic privacy features. For example, our room had a big window in the bathroom, and there wasn't even a curtain over it; just a transparent shade. We had to hang a towel over it to ensure the cars and pedestrians outside couldn't see in. Also, the bathroom door in our room was basically a thin closet door that didn't even completely obscure viewing, let alone block sound. On another random note, the TV was also old so half of its pixels didn't work right. These were all shocking inconveniences for a hotel that costs this much per night on an absolute scale, but then again it is in Beverly Hills, where the truly nice hotels are much more expensive.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: The service was great and the staff was phenomenal. However, the room was very small and uncomfortable. One would expect a better room for the cost per day which was extremely high. On the plus side, the location was excellent.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: Great staff. Great atmosphere. The continental breakfasts were high quality and full of variety. I loved the lush inner courtyard, full of plants and inviting seating areas. The room, 48,was small but had lots of spaces to keep organized. Valet parking was efficient and accommodating. Walking from the hotel to Rodeo drive was a pleasure. Quiet streets with beautiful gardens and tall trees. I would happily return.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: The hotel is cozy and very well located for sightseeing in Los Angeles. Two major problems have affected our stay: The constant noise in the garden facing our room by other guests late at night and early in the morning, and the low quality dinner available at the restaurant in the hotel.
ReviewTitle: A very cozy hotel but very noisy

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: The only reason I didn't say Excellent is because I could hear other people in my room at time. The staff was excellent, very positive, helpful and professional. The location was great for what I wanted at the last minute, bit noisy at first but it posed no problem when I slept. So close to Melrose and within walking distance of Casa Madre, which I love.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: Great place! I always try to stay here when I come to Los Angeles. Close to restaurants and entertainment. Super cute.. and the view from the roof is amazing. Service is great and the restaurant attached is really good too if you don't want to walk to dinner.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: The inside courtyard and rooftop lounge are nice. The breakfast in the cafe is definitely above average. I have stayed here twice. My first room had two beds and was fine for 2 people. If you try staying with 4 people it will be crowded. The room and bathroom are small but nicely furnished. The room has a small refrigerator. If you bring children, grab the mini bar candy and alcohol basket and hide it or ask management to remove before you check in. My second room had only one bed which had more room, but the location was terrible. It was close to the stairs and was in the corner of triangular courtyard. My room windows faced the outdoor walkway for the other rooms. No privacy. I would not want that room again.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: The property is well situated for access to Melrose and the design community. The rooms are decorated with understatement and class. They're very small though. Forget all that though. What counts is the people. They cared for me and all of the members of my family who've stayed there as though we were part of their family. Care and attention to detail shined like a halo over everything they did. Attaching car seats, bringing up luggage, room cleaning when I needed it late, a cheery morning greeting, and so on. Breakfast is great and served late.

ProviderLocation: 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-3967 469 N Doheny Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-3967
ReviewText: I found this lovely property for a very reasonable price and stayed two nights this week. The room is tiny (!!) but you can't beat the location in this Beverly Hills meets West Hollywood setting. I also really enjoyed Cafe Amici. Linger over breakfast as it's fun - the latte is good and the small setting means guests naturally mingle which was enjoyable as a solo traveller on this occasion. Friends joined me there the night before for drinks in front of the cosy fireplace as the rain came down outside. We did not eat dinner there but the menu looked good. The service is a little inconsistent as said in the other reviews but I found the low key personable vibe really nice as opposed to the big hotel, faceless feel. Concierge advice was also good. I look forward to coming back in warmer times to enjoy the rooftop terrace and the courtyard,

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: Don't be put off by the rock and roll history and branding. This is a very comfortable and modern hotel in a very quiet location. We arrived in a terrible storm and the car valet, reception and check in could not have been smoother. We were confined to the hotel because of the storm but the bedroom and sitting room suite of over 500 square feet gave ample space to sit out the storm. Good restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner.Excellent wine list and house wines. Because of the rain we couldn't see the garden - which was a disappointment. Minor complaint are the long dark dreary corridors decorated in Communist era brown. We didn't see any rock stars.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: We stayed 6 nights as part of a trip for my partners 40th. We didn't really look at any other hotels as my partner wanted to stay here due to the history of the place. We had a basic king room which was very spacious and a big bathroom. We arrived to a lovely cakes and champagne chilling which was a really nice tough - Thanks! The property has been modernised over the years and it has that cool, Hollywood laid back vibe. We had good service at all times and really enjoyed our star spotting stay, its not cheap but we would stay again, it's a stones throw from Sunset Strip.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: Sunset Marquis is a lovely hotel. Quiet and relaxing. The staff were very pleasant and friendly, and despite its rich rock and roll history, it’s not a pretentious hotel. We enjoyed chatting with the bar staff at Bar 1200 before heading out on an evening. The location, just off Sunset, is excellent which makes is walking distance to bars and restaurants on the strip, or a longer stroll down to Santa Monica. A couple of streets East there are some nice older roads lined with lovely villas, and the area is steeped in West Hollywood history. The spacious rooms (as opposed to the villas) are located around the central courtyard with a nice pool. They are well appointed, with an amazingly comfortable bed and huge, powerful shower. We had a second floor corner room with a large balcony that had a nice sofa to relax on in the evening, before heading out to enjoy the fun of Sunset. The villas are dotted around in the lush gardens behind the main hotel, where there’s a second pool and the restaurant, Catavina. The décor of the hotel highlights the rock history, with fantastic photos from the Morrison Hotel gallery lining the walls. The corridors are dark and rooms on the minimalist side – although very comfortable – so it’s got a nice cool vibe, but this isn’t the hotel for you if you like plush carpets and ornate décor. If you love music and want to chill out, this is the place.
ReviewTitle: Relaxing, Comfortable Stay, Steeped in Rock and Roll History

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: Quiet, beautiful with a fabulous rock n roll history of who's who. We loved that it did not matter who you are, you're a guest. There were "name" guests there who received the same impeccable service as we did. We all interacted with no regard for status. You don't have to be hip and cool. You just have to be. Nobody running around with cameras taking photos. Discreet and anonymous are the words of the day, every day. The tragically hip that tried too hard to be cool were only a slight annoyance. Food at the restaurant was very good. Enjoyed the brunch tremendously. The only drawback are the hangers on who camp out in the restaurant for hours on end hoping to see someone famous and the whiners who discover they cannot wander the grounds or dine poolside with the guests. That is what we pay for-solitude from the masses and a quiet place to just be, Villas are private and lovely. Many secluded ways of entering without being seen by everyone. Every possible thing is already thought of and waiting for you. If not, call and it appears. Loved the service. Loved the villa. Loved the people. Loved the solitude. The walk through the villas at night is magical.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: If you're hip and want to stay at a old Hollywood hot spot this is the Hotel for you. It's located in a Hollywood neighborhood wright off of Sunset and walking distance to many restaurants & even the world famous comedy club. The rooms are large and in charge with all the amenities.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: I was grieving the loss of a friend and decided to keep my plans to visit Los Angeles. I was gifted a room for the night. It was a perfect place to stay in and order room service, sleep in the most comfortable bed, swim in the prettiest pools and eat the tastiest chocolate chip cookie. The grounds are vast, and lushly verdant. A great place to get lost, party or rest, Los Angeles is. To stay at the Sunset Marquis is a charmed life indeed.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: I really enjoyed my experience at the Sunset Marquis. I stayed in one of the villas for a week and was not disappointed! These rooms are beautifully decorated and live like luxury apartments. The staff was excellent and went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The grounds are beautiful with mature landscaping. It almost feels like walking in a beautiful forest and yet you are half a block from Sunset Strip-so the location is also ideal while being very private. My only complaints were no coffee maker in the room (a big deal for me) and the "ala carte" charge of $11.95 per night for wifi-really, in a $600 per night room! This part felt a little like flying on a budget airline. Other than these two small items, the experience was first class! As a bonus, the Sunset Marquis has a phenomenal rock star history going back to the mid 60's!
ReviewTitle: Wonderful experience, beautiful grounds, excellent location and a rock star history!

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: Not a five star hotel but the recent renovation serves its purpose for the picky traveler on a limited budget. The gut renovation of my room was outstanding; quality furniture and fixtures, modern electronics and contemporary design excellence. The public areas, including lobby, pool, hallways, etc. are more like an older Holiday Inn and not really up to speed except for the many awesome historical photos of prior rock star guests. Fun and interesting! At the end of the day though, I still like the Peninsula, BHH, or Hotel Belair.
ReviewTitle: Rooms are as new, fresh, and modern as you can get....

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: I have stayed at this hotel frequently and it seems less and less training is done with the front desk staff I had called months ahead to try to get an early check in as I was only going to be in the room a few hours before an event I was there for and a few hours to sleep. While I did get q bit of an early check in ate staff speaks to you like you're a dummy. They kept saying " well we were full last night" I flew in to lax for only 18 hours I love hotel but wish they could work on better communication with guests Next time I need an early check in I will try an American Express platinum hotel

ProviderLocation: 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood , CA 90069 1200 Alta Loma Rd , West Hollywood, CA 90069
ReviewText: Just arrived back in London from an eight day stay at Sunset Marquis in West Hollywood. My daughter just got married and is living in LA and she had highly recommended it to me. I had a one bedroom villa which was spacious, comfy with every mod con you could possibly want plus a little patio with table and chairs. There was a bar/kitchenette area where I could make my own snacks or be enticed with those on offer from hotel. I am a gluten and dairy free girl and this posed no problem at all at breakfast (or any other meal) and was even able to have gluten free pancakes (this is LA after all!) The restaurant is surrounded by lush vegetation and a stream which leads to a pool full of Koi carp. Once you have entered reception and pass the first swimming pool the path to my villa was like walking through a tropical garden and there were lovely hummingbirds who joined me every morning on my patio for breakfast. London and its grey winter skies seemed a long way away. Atmosphere was totally relaxing in spite of hotel having quite a "rock n roll" vibe. Very central location. Easy to get Uber taxis here. Easy to walk up to Sunset Blvd ,where there are good shops and cafes, and you can browse safely. Am missing my daughter and this hotel already and will definitely be back next year!

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: There are very few accessible rooms with ocean views in Santa Monica. This is one of the few. The Viceroy is a lively and luxurious boutique hotel within walking distance of Santa Monica pier and Third St. Promenade. We stayed in room 808 which affords an expansive ocean view, overlooking the rooftop of Shutter's Hotel. Room door width is 33 in. Bath door width is 28.75 in. with a tiled ramp into the bathroom. Sink knee clearance is 29 in., depth is 14 in. Shower is 35 in. x 64 in. with an open glass entrance of 36 in. Toilet height is 17.5 in. Bed height is 30 in., which is high for someone who is unable to stand. Tip: When visiting the pier, consider driving over the bridge to the parking area because of the steep slope and narrow pedestrian walkway. Terrain is otherwise flat and paved. Plenty of restaurants, cinema and retail shopping nearby.
ReviewTitle: Wheelchair accessible room with an Ocean View

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: Situated just one short block back from the beach this boutique hotel has charm and a cool vibe. Beautifully appointed rooms. Lively bar with good music. Our flight was delayed and we arrived 11pm. Regretfully they only serve room service at this hour. But the beef sandwich was to kill for. Great find. It's our second visit. And worth saving a few dollars than staying right on the beachfront.

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: My last time at the Viceroy. It is a nice hotel with a beautiful garden, and pool area at the back. In summer (only), it's a nice spot. Not in February. For an ocean view king, the price was $500 after tax, plus $45 for mandatory car valet, then say $5 tip, so $550 per day. There was no real ocean view on the 5th floor as buildings block the view. The bar is very average, uninspiring. In short, nice hotel, but way over-priced for what you really get.

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: We stayed for only one night and had a great experience. In fairness, we booked the hotel last minute on hotels tonight. So for the discounted price we had a great time. I can't say we would have been thrilled had we paid full price. The rooms were on the smaller side but very clean. Comfy beds. Overpriced room service, and the bar as well but decent food and they were quick to deliver. $49 valet parking and they literally parked it in an empty spot 100 feet from where we got out. That was disappointing but expected. Very close to the beach and the pier. The hotel is exactly as you would imagine a Viceroy to be.
ReviewTitle: Exactly as pictured. Great hotel but not cheap!

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: There is a lot to like about The Viceroy but compared to The London (where we also stayed on this trip) it could do with a bit more attention to detail. Let's start with the good bits - the location is great, easy access to lots of fun places in Santa Monica and Venice Beach and the room (a junior suite) was a decent size and had an incredibly comfortable bed and the decor is bright and stylish. The gym is small but well equipped and the bar is great, good service and delicious bar snacks. The valet guys are also terrific. Less great was the mini bar - "we've run out of gin" - sad news after long flight as well as lengthy time to access room - "supervisor is checking housekeeping" and the price of filter coffee at breakfast - $13. Really! These are small things in the scheme of things but could do with improving. PS breakfast across the road at Cora's Coffee Shop good alternative to expensive coffee
ReviewTitle: Fabulous location and most comfortable beds

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: I stayed here for two nights in Feb 2017. It was my second visit having stayed here shortly after it opened about 13 years ago. I was hesitant because I don't like staying in hotels that feel worn but the hotel looked brand new. The service exceeded my expectations at every level. From the check in person who suggested showing me different room types so I could have options, to the concierge who was always on point and super helpful, to the valet guys who were super curteous and prompt to the overnight room service person who asked if everything was ok when I ordered camomile tea at midnight. It felt like a rosewood or four seasons hotel experience at every point. I would have no hesitation to stay again. Kudos to Lance who got the subtleties of my concerns and provided information that was always pertinent even if I and not asked for it. I would highly recommend this Viceroy.

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights passing through Santa Monica. Lovely hotel! Very welcoming staff, champagne on arrival is a nice touch! Decor is very cool and chic, great place to meet for a drink in the lobby/by the pool. Room was comfortable and had a nice view of the pool area. Huge tv and comfy, clean bed. Great location as an easy walk to 3rd street. Borrowed a bike one day and rode to Abbot Kinney and along Venice beach - idillic! Car parking is expensive but standard in SM I think. Concierge very knowledgeable and helpful. I had a late flight back to London and even after checkout all the staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel for a short/long stay in Santa Monica.

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: This is a very odd title for a review, but it was VERY pleasant to walk in the beautifully appointed lobby of the Viceroy and be enveloped in this heavenly scent. I selected this hotel for the first time due to proximity to beach and positive reviews. I was not disappointed. My room was lovely, comfortable, had a view of urban Santa Monica but that was OK. The pool and cabanas and landscaping and outdoor dining was just what you'd envision in a hip beach hotel, with a bit of old-world glamour yet certainly not stuffy. Despite the fact that I'm not a hipster, I was treated very warmly by all staff. In fact, I saw a real range of folks there - families, young beauties, middle-aged folks like myself. The only thing I didn't like was the charge for parking - maybe it was $40? I just wish hotels would include these charges in their room rates. I'll return though!
ReviewTitle: Wonderful scent when you walk in the lobby!

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: Have stayed at the Viceroy 5-6 times over the last 5 years - and once again it delivers on quality - from upbeat decor, free bikes to fantastic service (Casey - concierge - is such a delight). Glad they have restricted large parties/events from the hotel (unless you are staying) - keeps it more boutique and intimate (and not as noisy). Love the Viceroy and will be returning - definitely.

ProviderLocation: 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-3215 1819 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-3215
ReviewText: Just stayed 4 nights at the Viceroy Santa Monica & I could not fault the service one little bit. Everything was done to higher than my expectations from the moment I received champagne on arrival through to my checkout. Nothing was too much trouble. I felt like a special part of their family!! My room was gorgeous & comfortable, the food yummy, the pool & decor absolutely sensational, not to mention the courteous, kind & knowledgable staff. I will definitely return & highly recommend the Viceroy Santa Monica. Well done guys.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: Service is so bad! Staffs are extremely slow and not smart and more interested to chitchat and get annoyed when guests ask something. The front office took minutes to check information/front page of my passport. D'uh!! We ask for complimentary bottle of water for the second night (we stay here for 3nights) they said we can't get it more instead force us to take the one we need to purchase for 5$. When I said every hotel I stay worldwide at least provide complimentary bottle daily. And they said: no ma'am its not written in your booking that the bottle of water is included.. since when?!? Such a joke! The Churchill is the hotel bar, we went there for few drinks while wait for my friend to pick us, the hosts said its all reserved while they are all empty. The only nice thing I find here is the location and the concierge.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: This is our last night of a 5 night stay at the Orlando. The best thing about the hotel is the location within walking distance of the Grove, Farmer's Market and the Beverly Center. The Orlando is on Third Street which has a lot of interesting little boutiques, restaurants and tons of nail salons. However in my opinion the hotel is getting tired. The lighting in our room was poor, the washroom was very small and the people behind the desk were sometimes friendly and sometimes not. It would have been nice to be provided with bottles,of water in the room. We also had problems with the heat off and on. It was quite cold during our stay so we needed heat. I would consider staying elsewhere the next time my husband and I visit L.A.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: Out of all the hotels during our recent USA trip, this is the only one with in-room tea/coffee facilities. That's five stars for me! But the room itself is very modern and clean. Staff were friendly. It's located around 40min by car from LAX and Uber was used to travel to the theme parks etc. We didn't get to use the pool.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: My partner and I stayed at The Orlando overnight and thought it was a great hotel with a definite boutique feel. The staff were all courteous and the room beautifully appointed. We enjoyed a delicious lunch and some lovely cocktails in their indoor/outdoor restaurant and bar. Will definitely stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night while we were in LA and the hotel was beautiful and the staff was lovely! We enjoyed every minute there. The location was great and getting Ubers to get around the town was very convenient location wise.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: Modern, clean,all the amenities you need. Room was a good size. Realitively quiet room at back if hotel. Good gym. Pool very small. Location great for central starting point. Walking distance to Beverly centre and grove. Plenty of restaurants near by. Only real complaint is wifi was terrible. Weak and kept dropping out. Staff were friendly and helpful
ReviewTitle: Modern boutique hotel in good location

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: I just spent five days at The Hotel Orlando. I loved the boutique feeling of this hotel. The rooms are a good size, staff friendly and helpful, nice, hip restaurant downstairs, quiet, walk to endless great restaurants and shops, cute freshwater pool. I will definitely stay at The Orlando again when I am in L.A.
ReviewTitle: Great boutique hotel, private, quiet, hip neighborhood, central to Beverly Hills/Hollywood

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: W. 3rd Street is nice and central to many areas -Close to the Beverly Centre - Hop-on hop off bus pick up, Melrose Ave, The Grove and Farmers Market. Stayed in room 409. Great sized bathroom and very comfortable room- had a bath which was great. Air con was a little noisy but no issues with traffic noise. Had a late flight - 11hrs after check out and couldn't get a late check out however they had an area where I could shower and was able to use the amenities within the motel. I would definitely recommend

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: Located on 3rd street, one of the few slightly pedestrian-friendly areas of the LA, the hotel is near The Beverly Center/Connection, Joan's on Third, and, for the dedicated walker, The Farmers Market and Grove Shopping complex. Being near La Cienega allows you to start your north/south travels pretty quickly upon leaving the property. My room, 405, was done in a darker, masculine color-palate, with nice furnishings and plentiful storage tucked around the room. Because of the dark wood color, some wear and tear was visible. Not excessive, but obvious in this color wood. Bedding was very comfortable with plentiful pillows. The room had a view across 3rd street and, at an angle, the Hollywood Hills in the distance. The street noise was noticeable, despite the new windows, so if you prefer silence to view, you might want to select a room facing the small pool in the back. The bathroom was spacious, well-stocked with amenities, and had a walk-in shower (no tub in my room). Staff at the front desk were always helpful, and the valet staff were unfailingly fast and friendly getting my car (despite the fact I kept leaving items in it and needed to have it brought up). This is a boutique, first class hotel. Not full of all luxury frills, and priced accordingly. Staff is friendly, but you won't be quite as coddled as some of the other properties in the vicinity. I enjoyed it, and would certainly consider staying again on a future visit.

ProviderLocation: 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel) 8384 West 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Formerly Beverly Plaza Hotel)
ReviewText: This five-story boutique hotel has a fitness center, a pool, and a restaurant. This was my fifth stay and I continue to return because of its size, the friendliness of its staff, and its location, which is within walking distance of charming shops and delicious restaurants.

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: When we go to California, I always make it a point to stay at the Ambrose. It's clean, quiet and convenient. The breakfast is included and is really good. They will drive you to the shopping district whenever you want as part of their service free of charge. The Ambrose has been my "go-to" place for 5 years!

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: For holiday or business purposes alike. The only tiny flaw is the seating in the breakfast room. Not very comfortable and too few seats. That might be better in summer, when you can sit outside in the small garden. But the buffet is great.

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: We found our stay to be so very comfortable and well taken care of during our 2 day stay at this great location! Our stay included a breakfast which was well provided with fruit, pastries, juice and great coffee!

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: Superlatives in every regard. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable accommodations. Morning breakfast buffet is excellent. Location close to beach and shopping but does require transportation or a 30 minute walk one-way.

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: Beautifully appointed contemporary boutique hotel. On a quiet street but only a half block from the shops and restaurants of Wilshire Blvd. Great place to stay if you're going to St Johns or UCLA Med (Santa Monica) - both a short walk away. Very quiet soundproofed room, large modern bathroom, good complementary breakfast. Staff was very friendly and attentive, even when we arrived very late at night. We'll definitely be back!

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: If you do not want to stay in the hustle and bustle and enjoy a walk or bike ride, this hotel is a perfect option. They are very green and conscious also by having organic teas and coffees and wonderful refreshments.

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: I spent a week here, post Thanksgiving. This was probably my fifth visit in the last eight or so years. So, yes, I like The Ambrose very much. Expensive - parking underneath cost as much as my hire car for the week. Petty grouse: Breakfast not quite what it was. Croissants not what they were. On four of the days no glasses were made available for juice or water and I was told there were paper cups. If I wanted that I'd go to Starbucks. That said, still a fine spread. On reflection I think the reason I love this hotel is that the bedding, mattress and linen, are absolutely excellent. And it's a quiet, understated home away from home. European.

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: Stayed 3 nights while attending a seminar around the corner. Very clean, up to date and comfortable. Staff was friendly and attentive. I enjoyed the property and will certainly stay here again next time I'm in Santa Monica.

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: It's hard to find a nice hotel in Santa Monica that is not super expensive. This place is just right. While it's been around awhile, it feels newly built. Nice beds, lobby, outdoor courtyard. Minimal street noise, though typical hotel hallway sounds. Very professional staff- helpful, cheerful. Breakfast offers high quality pastries, yogurt, and fresh fruit, plus instant cereals, etc. Free local car service. The location near St. John's Hospital means some average food choices within walking distance, but if you want Santa Monica's downtown outside your door, you will pay double this price. Will definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again

ProviderLocation: 1255 20th St , Santa Monica , CA 90404-1351 1255 20th St , Santa Monica, CA 90404-1351
ReviewText: I stayed at the Ambrose for two nights. The hotel was clean, reasonable, but lacked atmosphere, and was far away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Santa Monica. The breakfast was minimal. Not a holiday type of hotel and I suspect that it gets most of its business from the nearby hospital and people on business trips. I personally would not want to stay there agin, malignly because it lacked atmosphere, but the room was fine and the bathroom clean. Very pricey for what is was, but fortunately I was not paying.
ReviewTitle: Basic and uninspiring accommodation in Santa Monica

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: The location is perfect, and the staff is pleasant, friendly, helpful, and will do anything to help enhance your stay. The reason I gave the room a 3 is because the drawers were a bit broken and the room was a bit damp.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: Great personal service. Accommodations were better than expected. Parking was a bit of an issue. , tough to park with a full size vehicle. The breakfast provided was similar to most complimentary breakfasts that others provide.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: We stayed two nights at the Carlyle. The hotel is an inward facing hotel, with an outside sitting area enclosed by the hotel. We didn't use the hot tub, although, it didn't appear to be too hot (no steam despite cool temperatures). Some people complained about the room size, but, we felt that it was sufficiently large for two people. The breakfast is standard free breakfast, nothing special. The hotel also has a happy hour during the week -- wine, beer, chips, dip, cheese and crackers. Once again, nothing special, but, it's free! The neighborhood has several restaurants close by -- we enjoyed the casual carryout at Komodo.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: The hotel is an oasis of comfort. The staff is warm and friendly with great knowledge of the area. The beds are sumptuous and inviting. Our room was on Robertson, it had double windows for noise suppression. It was very quiet when closed up and it opened up in the day for great cross ventilation and fresh air. The breakfast is fresh and plentiful. The happy hour has a nice variety. The surrounding neighborhood is interesting and multicultural with an abundance of eateries to sample and enjoy.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: Me and my husband planned a 2 night vacation in LA before heading to our Honeymoon. This was one of the best parts of our trip to La. The decor was really well done. The staff are very professional and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: The first night of my stay I was awaken at 2:00 am by the people arriving at room 202 ....they continued to loudly "party" for several hours. The second night, the room above me was occupied by people that seemed to be constantly running around the room...I thought I was sleeping below a basketball court. Not very relaxing level of sleep needless to say. Most likely would select another property on my next stay in the area....this seems to be a "party" hotel. Respectfully, Brad Alewine

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: The Carlyle Inn is quite close to where my daughter lives so I tried it out after having previously stayed in Hilton family hotels (since I'm a Hilton Honors member) that were further away. I definitely would stay at The Carlyle again. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable. I requested a room not facing South Robertson Blvd to have a quieter experience and they accommodated that request, which I appreciated (and the room was much quieter than the last Hilton family hotel I stayed in). The breakfast was simple, but just fine for me. I was glad that both hard boiled and scrambled eggs were offered as a little protein to start the day is important for me. I really enjoyed eating breakfast in the hotel's courtyard since it was "another perfect day" in LA each day of my stay. I gave 4 stars rather than 5 stars as the safe in my room didn't work nor did the shower drain. I reported both of these things to the front desk, more as maintenance issues rather than complaints, and the hotel somewhat unexpectedly gave me a discount on the room rate, which was nice. So, a 4 star rather than 5 star review but I would definitely stay there again hoping to have no maintenance issues in my room.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: Perfect place to stay before having spinal surgery at cedars sinai hospital which was close by. Hopefully the next time I stay it will be for a much better time seeing Beverly Hills etc Quiet room was ordered and I was able to have a good nights sleep before surgery
ReviewTitle: Stayed before surgery at Cedar Sinai Hospital

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: I arrived early, way before check-in, and Evelyn assisted me. She directed me to places near by to eat. When I returned, my room was ready - still before check-in which gave me time ton rest before my event. The room was very clean, the bed very comfortable and it was quiet for sleeping. The most warm welcome I've received from a Hotel in a long time. Thanks, Evelyn and the Carlyle Inn House Keeping staff.

ProviderLocation: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90035-1403 1119 South Robertson Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
ReviewText: i have enjoyed staying here the past 4 nights - comfy bed, big fluffy white towels and bathrobe, fridge, safe, wifi and great staff who were only too happy to give me an early check in and late check out. thank you so much! it makes long distance travel so much better. the location is great too - walking distance to a number of places - lovely quiet streets nearby with pretty gardens. I will be back!

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: There were no drinking glasses in the room. No shampoo, no soap, Bathroom floor and shower had hair in/on it. Sand in the main room on the floor. Dont know if WiFi was included because no one gave us password. Parking was $39.00 a night but for the public it was $30.00. paid for a upgraded room but dont know what if anything we got for that. ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: we stayed 5 nights in a ocean view with balcony room; it was really beautiful. The room was renewed, clean and very big; it has a king size comfortable bed, big lcd tv, wi-fi, etc. Also the bathroom was big, bright and with a huge shower. We booked from italy this hotel 9 months in advance and the price was the best in the Santa Monica seaside area. We had a wonderful stay because it was our honeymoon. ReviewTitle: Honeymoon from Italy to Santa Monica

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: Perfectly located on the beachfront in Santa Monica. I love this hotel. The staff are amazing. Special thanks to Danielle in reservations and Elizabeth on the front desk. The booking process online was simple and immediate. Our greeting on arrival by Elizabeth was informative, while being warm and professional. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, being return guests. Which was pleasantly unexpected. Comfortable king bed, and lovely white shutters on the Windows. Housekeeping staff were also delightful and friendly. On departure, we had a late flight, so even though we checked out of our room, the hotel stored our luggage, and we were able to use a bathroom to freshen up and change clothes before we went to LAX. Easy walk from the hotel to 3rd street shopping / restaurants and Santa Monica pier. We will definitely look forward to our return to Santa Monica

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: We arrived at around 7pm with a friendly welcome by the Valet. The receptionist then sorted our room out and we went up to our room we had booked in advance. (Room 1) Upon inspection the bathroom was not clean, hairs in the and shower, the floor was dirty and the shower door handle was loose. We went back down to reception to complain about the issue and they offered us a different room, which we took up. (Room 2) We had a dinner reservation for 8pm, so we were in a rush to swap rooms, we put our luggage and had a quick look around. Unbelievably, this room was also not clean! When we went down to catch our Uber for dinner, we spoke to the manager and asked him to have the room cleaned before our return from dinner, he apologised and gave us free parking for the two nights we were staying. When we got back we checked the room, as we were now sceptical about their cleaning abilities we checked the room further and it only got worse. The shower still had hairs in it, and we found a hair in the bed sheets along with stains on the pillow case. Another call to reception, who told us the manager had now gone for the evening. (9.40pm) They offered us a third room which we took, however it took until 10pm to get us to this room. (Room 3) This room had beach views (so was an upgrade on our first two car park view rooms). I'm pleased we hadn't paid a premium for it as the view was limited and you actually had all the road noise being on the front of the property. This room had been double checked before we got into it, and alas we had a clean room! Great. The young chap who helped us changed rooms was very polite and helpful. The next morning, we discovered that the window lock did not work in this room which we reported to reception and they had fixed while we were out that day. All three of the rooms we experienced were on the small side, we have stayed at 6 different hotels during our holiday (road trip) and these have been the smallest rooms by a large margin. The bathrooms, have poor water pressure and the ventilation is inadequate to deal with the steam of showering. The provided toiletries, were of a good standard. Also in all three bathrooms the toilet roll holder was loosely fitted to the wall, I suspect they need to upgrade these to a better standard of fitting. The furniture in the bedrooms is of good quality and the bed was comfy. Nice lighting and a good quality tv. There is a well stocked mini bar, which of course is hideously expensive. Half the hotels we have stayed at have provided free bottled water, which I think could easily be provided given the large price tag on these rooms. The location of this hotel is good, close to the pier, shopping and restaurants. The price of this hotel is not acceptable considering the experience we had. (We were also given $100 credit, after we had checked out by the manager, which we had not asked for, but it was a nice gesture given the experience). So we would not recommend staying here and we certainly will not be back anytime soon.

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: This is a lovely spot. Close to the beach and great food and shopping. Room was very nice. We didn't need the view so we had an interior room. Everyone was friendly. Would stay again for sure. Only thing I would suggest would be to have bottled water at no fee to guests in room for the coffee maker. Other than that I loved the room. Decor was super gorgeous. Modern. Clean. Great!

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: Just spent another week at Ocean View over the Thanksgiving Holiday. I'm from the Midwest so I like to be able to view the ocean when I wake up in the morning. The Third Street Promenade is right around the corner -- great for Black Friday shopping, restaurants, etc. As a returning customer, I feel like family as everyone from the hotel manager, front desk, housekeeping and garage all remember me. Definitely will return to Ocean View.

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: Hotel was a great time, very nice property, modern look, not too big. Awesome location not too far at all from Santa Monica pier (hyper touristy), dinning, bars, and Venice beach experience (interesting). Blue daisy is a pricey but awesome breakfast spot nearby. Staff was very nice. Only complaint is parking fees/hotel fees.

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: Great location right by the pier. Lobby is really nice, bed was very comfortable, and the staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Even the person who valeted my car refused to let me take my suitcase and did everything for me. The room price is expensive, but with all the California taxes added on and for the area, I think it was a normal price. I would stay here again!

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: I have stayed at so many hotels in California over the years even since I moved from NYC To CA. This is my second review ever. However it is due for all travelers heading to California for the first time to those in need of a break from home. The "Ocean View Hotel" in Santa Monica truly has blown me away. It's a boutique hotel so don't expect room service, however the employees go above and beyond for those staying at the hotel. Barry whom works at the bell desk will make anything happen with the largest smile on his face. So no need to fret over room service, as the hotel staff far compensated. I was massively craving Sugarfish and with the largest smile Barry got it for me in no time. The front desk manager Elizabeth clearly is doing a great job as both Jose and Greg also do everything with a s**t eating grin. The hotel must be managed well; the saying "happy wife happy life". It continues to this gem of a hotel. "Happy employees happy costumers" ..... I promise you will not be disappointed!

ProviderLocation: 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica , CA 90401-2116 1447 Ocean Avenue , Santa Monica, CA 90401-2116
ReviewText: This was my second time staying at this hotel and it was another great experience. The staff is very kind and attentive. Elizabeth at the front desk was very helpful with my accommodations. The rooms and premises are all very clean. I will be staying there again.

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: Everything about the stay was first class. I love the decor and vibe. Check in, Tres hostess, concierge and the driver all made me feel like a rockstar. Well done hiring and training! I work for a Country Club and things like that happen to the best of places. Just thought I'd write that they are human too!
ReviewTitle: Fantastic stay at SLS Beverly Hills

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: We had a great time at SLS Miami so we really had high hopes for SLS Beverly Hills. However it was not the case, we stayed at ROOM 353 and the housekeeper there was either not very careful or not HONEST. I left my bracelet on top of the table and I definitely remember it being there so when I called and email to ask if anyone returned a jewelry left inside our room I was surprised when they said no. The bracelet has a very sentimental value, it was a special gift from my mom and until now it still makes me feel very awful thinking about what happened. I'm very very disappointed with SLS and how they took care of this. ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: Came here for 2 nights while in the LA area. A real happening hotel great for people watching. The staff was tremendous. Great valet service as well as in their restaurants. We did have multiple issues including a leaky faucet in the bathroom. Our clock alarm went off at 6 am the first day and I unplugged the clock only to have housekeeping replug it in and set the clock 45 minutes ahead. So awoke a bit early the second day. The bathroom has 0 sound proofing as there is a sliding glass door and a sliding glade window to look into the room. Needless to say all noises heard in the bathroom. The room was very European and not that large. The bed is in the middle of the room with a desk behind it. There is no true lobby to hang out as there is a restaurant when you walk in and the only sitting area is outside the entrance. Platinum members get a free breakfast which is a $58 value for 2 people. Great little buffet breakfast which was very good. Very good service. They ran out of Nova the first day and they brought me pancakes instead. We also went to the main restaurant for dessert the second nIght. The bar scene was vibrant but service was missing. After my wife complained several times the manager moved us to a table in the desser area and bought our dessert which was very good. $42 a day for valet plus tax. Fitness center was nice and had working cardio machines. Pool table I believe on every floor of the hotel.
ReviewTitle: The Staff Put This Rating 4 Stars

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: Stunning rooms and finishes throughout. Superb food and dessert at Bazaar!!! Central location and easy walk or uber to a wide variety of interesting spots. Very polite professional staff. Free water is a nice touch.

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: stay very very good. It's a fun place with a cool vibe. Rooms are very nice. Bathroom water could use a little bump in water pressure and temperature levels thought. Ate at the restuarant in the hotel the first night, was a lot of fun and very good food. The staff was very nice and accommodating as well. Would definitely stay there again.

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
