ReviewTitle: My awesome visit to SLS LA

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: I have stayed here over ten times in the past year. The staff is so welcoming making a large hotel feel small. Good location to walk the area or drive anywhere you want to go. My daughter lives near The Grove, so the hotel is convenient for me. Walking on 3rd st to great places to eat and shop is great. Walk to Beverly Hills from the hotel a nice way to start the morning. The pool in the summer makes me feel young or old, not sure! Enjoy your stay!

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: I've stayed at almost every luxury hotel in LA and this one is still the one I dream about. There is something about the level of exceptionalism here that is over the top. I could have stayed here for a lifetime, but could only afford a night.

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: Hands down the best spot in the city. Great location in Beverly Hills. Fantastic restaurant. Great scene at night. Helpful staff...everyone is very courteous and wonderful. Nice spa. I have no complaints. I will keep staying there for all my future LA trips.

ProviderLocation: 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles , CA 90048 465 South La Cienega Boulevard , Los Angeles, CA 90048
ReviewText: Front desk staff are fantastic and are some of the nicest people I've encountered at hotels. Gorgeous hotel with an amazing rooftop pool that overlooks the city. Location is not the best but being in a residential neighborhood, there are 2 or 3 streets that you can park overnight for free if you want to avoid paying the $40 to park at the hotel.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: We thought the staff at the Montage saved it from being just another expensive, high thread count hotel. Everyone pitched in with smiles and suggestions, from the bellman's first comment, "Take the Rolls to the restaurant. It's free!" We had just driven up in our Honda! Indeed, the Montage will drive guests to restaurants and shops within a short radius of the hotel, and it does make a visit much more enjoyable given the traffic. The rooftop pool is perched in the perfect spot, and lounging above "90210" was a treat.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: I spent the most beautiful birthday at this lovely property in the heart of the Rodeo shopping district. From Check in to Check Out, the team was amazing in preparing our room, engaging us with local entertainment options, and their incredible service. This hotel is exquisite and I highly recommend for your next special occasion.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: A great stay at home vacation. We had wonderful service, great food, and a beautiful suite. I absolutely love the spa. I could easily spend the day there. The location is fantastic. You can walk to Rodeo drive or any of the stores on Rodeo Drive. The only thing I would like to change is a bigger pool area.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: Nicely decorated rooms with very comfortable beds; an attractive lobby and an excellent bar where you will be able to taste one of the best tuna tartare you will ever find. ReviewTitle: Excellent stay. We would definitely return.

ReviewText: Stayed here for 1 night. Clean beautiful grounds and hotel. Easy check in. The pool area is ok kinda of small. Clean rooms which is important the welcoming staff is very welcoming. Courtyard leads out to a few cafes.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: I stayed here last Saturday to attend a black tie event nearby. This hotel is absolutely wonderful and far exceeded my expectations! It's exclusive without feeling pretentious. There's no such thing as an unmet need here! Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a lovely premiere room. The space was perfect! The complimentary champagne was such a nice touch. Even the breakfast I ordered through in room dinning was wonderful! I didn't have the opportunity to explore the grounds or visit the spa- but I hope to be back soon to take advantage of their other amenities!!

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: I have stayed here twice and both times the rooms, the service and the restaurants have been top notch. Breakfast on the top floor is perfect with delicious juices and piping hot omelettes. They even manage to make the oatmeal taste special! Drinks in the evening are a nice way to people watch and while I have not tried Georgie, Scarpetta was always fabulous. Beds are firm, bedding smooth, crisp and cool and I have never had a bad view. Walking distance to everything and running paths nearby. Can't wait to return.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: Really loved the place - granted doesn't have the hippest crowed nor the nicest pool of the BHH but slept really well in the quality built and modern rooms (rare for la). The spa is unbelievable highly recommend it and amazing service. Really best spot in LA just the BHH may be more social.
ReviewTitle: The best of the best in LA

ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: Six hundred and ninty five bucks for a room in what my agent described as "vintage Hollywood", raises various scenarios in the banal humour of a traveller. ProviderLocation: 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills , CA 90210-5301 225 N Canon Dr , Beverly Hills, CA 90210-5301
ReviewText: The room was very comfortable and the service impeccable but not fussy. Definitely love that the house cars are Rolls Royce Ghosts! Location makes it a perfect jump spot for anywhere that you need to go.

ReviewText: Clean, comfortable. Microwave was helpful. HBO channel was a nice bonus. No problem with parking. I appreciated the coffee it was good. ProviderName: W Los Angeles - West Beverly Hills

ReviewText: My wife and I staid here because it was close to UCLA where I had a Conference to go to. The hotel is close to local restaurants and shops.

ProviderName: W Los Angeles - West Beverly Hills

ReviewText: It had been years since I stayed with ANY Starwood properties. I felt the service was secondary to the arrogance of W employees who were just so over it after 2.5 terrible stays years and years ago. This W was my last great time with a W but that was years ago, but still one of my fave stays (W/Moscone also a top rate). So, I had some PTO time that needed burning and off the W did I go while hanging with some WeHo pals. Before I arrived I was in contact with an SPG employee who already started putting meat ease that maybe customer service was back at W Hotels. Front desk was extra friendly without being condescending, that's appreciated especially when traveling to hip hotels. Anyway, no matter what I needed, FOH and BOH was more than gracious. I cannot say enough about the guest experience. It had been a long time but it's pretty obvious SPG has re-upped their guest experience game. That said, the place still is cool. The lobby lighting design is impressive but not overwhelming. Super cool bulbs in the mid-lobby enclave feels stylish but doesn't try too hard for the cool factor. My suite was comfortable, had just enough mid-century to not feel trendy, but I really loved the translucent mermaid wall art. One of my fave snaps on my Insta. If you're looking for a cool LA vibe without being stuck at way overpriced Sunset hot spots, this W is great. Close to the freeway, a pretty drive into Hollywood, the location is far removed from the malarkey on Sunset. STK is fun. Service was seamless but a bit impersonal but noting to worry about. Look, it's LA, there's far worse egos from servers elsewhere. Look for Jamal the bartender in the lobby bar. Solid cat, no ego, always friendly.
ReviewTitle: Visiting pals, chillin' solo the W way.

ProviderLocation: 930 Hilgard Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 90024-3033 930 Hilgard Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 90024-3033
ReviewText: I really have nothing bad to say about THIS particular W. Actually, it's probably the best W I have ever stayed in (and I've been to a few across the globe). The service was great, the front desk person actually insisted to come out of the hotel to check whether I'd parked in an allowed zone (I did not, so she probably saved me some serious $$$). As a Platinum member, I've got upgraded to an enormous Mega suite. Why not 5 stars, then, you might ask. Well, I just don't like the so-called "hip" concept of this chain, which also then draws a certain crowd. So maybe it's not fair (I chose to stay there knowing in advance what to expect ), but it is what it is. The location is great, just off of the Westwood Village, although it is really annoying that they call it "West Beverly Hills", which is an inaccurate marketing gimmick for a typical denizen of W's. Absolutely superb if one is visiting UCLA (2min walk), but the village itself is a nice touristy spot with restaurants and shops. From there, the (in)famous 405 freeway can take you anywhere (10-15min to the ocean, Santa Monica, Venice Beach, or hop over to the San Fernando Valley, and even the Downtown is not too far). Not to mention that LAX is less than 30min away. All these times should be taken with a grain of salt - LA traffic can be horrible. My favorite ride though is to drive along the Sunset Blvd - from this location enter at the ultra posh Bel Air, then go East through Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, Hollywood, all the way to Chinatown and Downtown, or with more time go West all the way to Malibu and the back before taking the above-mentioned East route. This could easily be a whole day, or more, if you visit places along the way (Getty Museum, shop in Bev. Hills, etc.).
